Kamudan özel günler için çiçek ve çelenk gönderiyolar.  1 oğlu üniversite 1 kızı ise lisede okuyor.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile çiçek dükkanın da alacağı canlı çiçek çeşidini arttırmak istiyor.  Alacağı çiçekler her kesimden müşteriye hitap ettiği için görünüşü ve çeşidiyle daha çok müşterisi olacağına inanıyor.  Eşiyle beraber hedefleri ise kızı ve oğluna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyolar.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Mükerrem

texts.en:
Mukerrem, mother of four, began her career working for others. Later, by saving a small sum from her workplace, she was able to open her own business selling underwear and women’s clothing.  She goes to the city market to sell her products.  First she used her income to repay her debts.  Raising four children, Mukerrem is driven, hardworking, and determined. She has plans and hopes for the future. With a loan from Maya, she will obtain more products for her business. In this way she plans to increase her customers and profit.  Her first goal is to expand her current business and increase her earnings.  In this way she wants to provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

4 çocuk annesi olan Mükerrem çalışma hayatına önce başkalarının yanında çalışarak başlamış.  Sonra,iç çamaşırı ve kadın giysisi satmaya başlamış.  Semt pazarlarına gidip,burada mallarını satıyor.  Daha sonra çalıştığı yerde ufak bir birikim sağlayarak kendisine küçük bir işletme açmış.  Önceliklikle sağladığı kazançla borçlarını kapatmış.  4 çocuğunu yetiştiren Mükerrem hırslı, çalışkan ve azimli bir bayan.  Gelecek ile ilgili planları ve ümitleri var.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile dükkanına daha fazla ürün temin edecek.  Böylece müşteri kapasitesini arttırmakla birlikte kazancını yükseltmeyi planlıyor.  Öncelikle ilk hedefi ise şu an ki işletmesinden daha büyük bir yer açmak ve işlerini kazancını büyütmek.  Bu sayede de çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek temin etmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her business

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en: Neelam is a 32-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of seasonal vegetables in his shop such as tomatoes, potatoes, peas, carrots, onions, etc .Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers for the winter season, which will help him increase his net income as well as his savings. However, due to a lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Neelam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase a variety of vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Neelam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of vegetables for the winter season

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is divorced and is a devoted mother of three children. At first she did women's eyebrows for money at her house and sold things she knitted. With her earnings, she paid for her daughter’s wedding. She increased her income by developing her knitting skills, creating items with different models for her friends and her neighborhood.  She believes that she will increase her sales by producing many more different kinds of knitting products with the help of the loan from Maya.  The loan from Maya will help Perihan increase her sales and she plans to increase her income.  Her future dream is, after her son completes his military obligations and returns, to open a shop for him and have him sell her products so that she will have more time for knitting new products. She wants to grow her business with her son and better support her children. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

3 çocuk annesi olan Perihan eşinden ayrılmış ve hayatını çocuklarına adamış bir bayan.  Önceleri evinde bayanların kaşlarını alarak ve örgü örerek çocuklarına kazanç sağlamış.  Sağladığı kazancı ile  1 kızını evlendirmiş.  Örgü de kendini ilerleten ve sürekli farklı modellerle arkadaşlarına, kendi çevresine ve arkadaşlarının çevresine satış yaparak gün geçtikçe gelirini biraz daha fazla artırmış.  Maya’dan alacağı kredi ile ürün temin edip daha farklı modeller örerek satış oranını arttıracağına inanıyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi Perihan’ın satışının artmasında destek olduğu gibi sağlayacağı gelirinde artmasını planlıyor.  İleride ki hayali ise oğlu askerden geldikten sonra bir dükkan açarak el örgülerini satışa sunmak istiyor.  Çok fazla satış yapan Perihan kendi yetişemediği için oğlu ile birlikte dükkanın başında durarak kazancı arttırmak, işini büyütmek ve çocuklarına daha iyi bir destek sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy knitting supplies

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Kadiatu from Magburaka, a northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married, with six children. 

In 1992, Kadiatu established her local food business. She began her business because she wanted to upgrade her standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more yams to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and to increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more yams to expand her business.

loans.name: Placido

texts.en:
The loan really assists Placido in his farm. He went to borrow from a bank, but he never got any assistance that way, and he thanks Maya Mountain Cacao (MMC) for their kindness in giving farmers loans.

Placido, age 57, is an organic cacao farmer. He lives in the beautiful village of Pueblo Viejo. This village is one of the remote villages, with no access to electricity. Placido, together with his wife, Florentina, raised nine children, of whom two still live with their parents.

Placido started planting cacao the hard way; he got seed from his dad and began planting on his own. He stated that corn and beans don’t bring as much income as cacao production. Cacao is a permanent crop that only requires proper cleaning, he says. He also cultivates different types of crops, such as corn, beans and rice, and he keeps cattle. Cattle and farming cacao are the easiest, Placido says. He presently has his own business shop.

Placido is requesting this loan to hire workers, who will assist him in properly cleaning his cacao farm. Presently, he faces no challenges with pests or disease.

Placido's future goals are to expand by many more cacao trees and to retire from farming. He hopes that one day, one of his children will take over the farming.

loans.use: to properly clean his cacao trees

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago, age 58, is an organic cacao farmer. He lives in the beautiful village of Red Bank, which lies between the South Stann Creek and Toledo. Santiago and his wife, Juana, raised their seven children, of whom five are still living with them. The other children have some sort of employment. His wife, Juana, spends most of her time attending to the children.

Santiago was inspired to plant cacao by the advisory of Agriculture from Guatemala, and his fellow farmers' advice. He manages his 1500 cacao trees up-to-date. Santiago holds outside employment, as well, which gives him limited time to properly clean his farm. Rain has been a challenge, he stated; the weeds grow too fast for him to control. His favorite of all is picking ripe pods and selling the product. Santiago also cultivates different types of crops for home consumption.

Santiago is requesting this loan to hire workers to clean his cacao trees. With this loan he would be able to have his cacao farm clean and continue his other employment, and his family will be happy at home.

Santiago's future goal is to expand with more cacao trees. He also wants to support his children financially, to get some level of education and find professional jobs.

loans.use: to clean and properly maintain his 1500 organic cacao trees, while continuing his other employment.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, age 50, is a female organic cacao farmer, who lives in the beautiful village of Laguna. Rosa, a single parent, has been struggling her way through raising her eight children. Now, most of them are employed and working. Rosa is a very ambitious person and works tirelessly; she is involved in tourism and small business, in addition to farming.

Rosa stated that her husband had started this cacao farm, before they separated. She now stays in charge of maintaining the farm, along with her children. She does inter-cropping farm techniques, which bring her money to feed her children and enable her to save a little income. Rosa enjoys working and growing cacao, because of its production and the income she earns for the family in this activity. She enjoys harvesting; however, last year the result was negative due to black pods in her cacao.

Rosa is requesting this loan to hire workers, to assist her in properly cleaning and managing the farm. This work will keep the farm free from disease, so the trees can be productive.

She plans to expand her farm in the future, and to continue planting more cacao plants. In this way, she will be able to continue to sustain her family and the market. She is, further, motivated to get her children educated, especially in tourism. Her cacao farm is used as a tourist destination.

loans.use: to hire workers, to properly clean the organic cacao farm.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe, age 59, is an organic cacao farmer who lives in the village of San Jose, where he manages his 3 acres of mature cacao trees. Felipe and his wife, Reymunda, raised their ten children, one of whom still lives with them. Reymunda spends most of her time doing crafts and harvesting cacao pods.

Felipe got motivated to farm cacao with his purchase of cacao seedlings from the Ministry of Agriculture. “It’s a permanent and profitable crop. Farming is good; all you need is cleaning. Farmers like to plant cacao as, when harvested, the sale price is good,” Felipe states. Felipe also cultivates different types of crops such as corn, beans, rice and a small vegetable garden to sustain his family's needs. "Farming is my life," he states. "All my income is from farming and the majority is cacao."

Felipe is requesting this loan to hire workers to assist him in cleaning his mature cacao trees and some underbrush for planting additional grafted seedlings this coming season.

Felipe's future goal is to expand with more cacao seedlings to continue receiving a high income and high production from his crops. He says that he wants his goal in farming to be achieved with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to properly clean 1,000 mature cacao trees

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 26-year-old single man who is responsible for six members of his family. Raed has been employed in a construction company and has specialized in internal decorations for the past nine years. He was only 16 years old when started working to financially support his family and he is their sole bread winner.

Raed is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to his family's house in order to keep it a healthy living place. In addition he will build an extra room for his family's increasing needs.

He hopes that in the future he will be capable of starting his own business, which he has always dreamed about. He wants to be a DJ and is working hard to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to make necessary improvements to his family's house

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de alegre y amable, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres juntos a sus hermanos compartiendo el mismo deseo por salir adelante. El negocio que tiene Cindy es la venta de comidas regionales. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes y esta actitud sumada a su buena sazón le ha permitido obtener muy buena acogida y demanda. Realiza este negocio desde hace 1 año con la ayuda de su madre. Le gusta su negocio pues comenta que le gusta cocinar gracias a las enseñanzas que su madre le brindó, del mismo modo también le agrada el ingreso económico que obtiene por sus ventas los cuales le han permitido pagar sus cuentas y ayudar a solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar. Al contrario no le gusta levantarse muy temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajando con mayor optimismo junto a su madre hasta culminar el día. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, comenta sentirse agradecida con el apoyo financiero que le brindarán para continuar desarrollando su negocio. Además afirma que se siente tranquila trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente todos los ingredientes que usa en la preparación de sus platillos como carnes, plátanos, aceite, condimentos, arroz y otros.
texts.en:
Cindy is a 21-year-old woman who is hard working and entrepreneurial, while also happy and friendly. She is a single woman with no children. Cindy lives at her parents home with her siblings who share her desire to get ahead. At Cindy's business she sells regional foods. She attends to her customers with a friendly nature. This attitude combined with her foods' good flavors have made her business welcome and provided high demand. 

Cindy has had this business for a year with help from her mother. She likes her business, commenting that she likes to cook thanks to the lessons that her mother has given her. The earnings she receives from her sales also please her because they have allowed her to pay her bills and help cover basic household costs. On the other hand, she doesn't like to wake up early in the morning to prepare for the day but this does not discourage her. She continues working alongside her mother with a great amount of optimism until the day comes to an end. 

Cindy is requesting 1,200 nuevos soles this time. She comments that she feels very grateful for the financial support that will be offered so she can continue developing her business. She also affirms that she feels content working with the members of her communal bank because she considers them to be responsible and supportive people. With the amount requested she will continue to buy all of the ingredients that she uses to prepare her dishes such as meat, plantains, cooking oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including meat, plantains, oil, condiments, and rice.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is from Dalarik village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, 7-year-old daughter, 3-year-old son, parents-in-law, and brother-in-law. 

Shoghik is employed in the government sector; she works as a teacher at the village local school. Her husband is a policeman, her mother-in-law is also a teacher in the same school, and her brother-in-law works in the private sector. All the family works hard to be able to cover their daily expenses. However, their salaries are so low that it is almost impossible to afford a living based on those salaries alone. Shoghik and her family members are also involved in cattle breeding, in breeding pigs and piglets, and in the cultivation of alfalfa, peaches and apricots. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income.

To continue running the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Shoghik needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase five steers, to buy forage for the livestock, and to purchase fertilizers. Shoghik and her large family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase five steers, buy forage for the livestock, and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through selling vegetables.  She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to acquire more capital. Her monthly expenses include school and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 60 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from Apaga village of Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband, daughter and son. Aida's husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant; he works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. Aida is engaged in the cultivation of greens and grapes. Her daughter and son help her sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income.

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Aida needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane, bottles), and to buy fertilizers. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Aida was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments.

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Aida and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane, bottles), and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, está acompañada, vive junto a su compañero de vida, para aportar económicamente a los gastos de su hogar por iniciativa propia aprendió el oficio de la costura, la cual ejerce desde hace 20 años, tiene un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., dependiendo de la demanda de sus clientes. Por el momento ha podido manejar su negocio sin ningún problema.
Solicita capital para invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, zippers, botones, algunos repuestos para la maquina y también le dará mantenimiento al equipo, espera que al contar con lo necesario para elaborar sus pedidos podrá tener clientes más satisfechos, mayores ganancias, con las que podar cancelar las cuotas y cubrirá gastos de su hogar.
Sueña con tener una sastrería mucho más amplia y bien equipada para dar una buena atención al público que hace uso de sus servicios.
texts.en:
María lives with her life companion. She learned how to sew at her own initiative in order to contribute economically to household expenses  She has been a seamstress for 20 years and keeps a 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. work schedule, depending on client demand. At the moment, she has been able to manage her business without any problems.

She is requesting capital to purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, a few parts for her machine and also to provide maintenance for her equipment. She hopes that having all she needs to fulfill her orders will result in more satisfied customers and greater profits. Thus she will be able to repay her debts and cover household expenses. She dreams of having a much bigger and better equipped tailoring shop so that she can provide good service to the public that makes use of her services.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Colón Cristobal

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Colon, tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene diez hijos, 9 mayores de edad y el menor de 16 años que estudia en colegio, dos de ellos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposa es ama de casa.
Don Colón es sastre de profesión, profesión que aprendió hace muchos años atrás, tiene un taller de costura donde se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que conocen de la calidad de sus obras, aunque en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 35 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y su familia. 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 4 ciclos  del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "San José" meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this lovely place. Most of the residents are hard workers who are devoted to jobs related to the sea.

Don Colón lives in this place. He is 56 years old, married, and has 10 children. Nine of them are adults and the youngest is 16 years old and a high school student. Two of his children still live at home. His wife is a homemaker.

Don Colón is a tailor by profession. He learned this profession many years ago. Don Colón has a tailoring shop where he makes all types of clothes for men and children. He works according to the orders he receives from specific individuals who are familiar with the quality of his work. Don Colón also has seasonal work since he makes uniforms for institutions, elementary schools, and high schools in the area. He works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Sometimes he works much later whenever he has orders that need to be delivered. Don Colón has been in this profession for more than 35 years and it has enabled his children and his family to get ahead.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics and other sewing materials. He has participated in four loan cycles with his Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the help the loans have provided have allowed him to move forward. His dreams include continuing to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Tabitha, 41 years old, has been running a business of maize farming in Nyahururu. She is a single mother of five children ages 19, 18, 13, 9 and 6 years.

To enable her to hire some laborers to assist her with maize cob harvesting and to buy some planting seeds, she has applied for her second loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 8,000 and her intention is to use the profits anticipated from her expanded business to educate her children. In the future, Tabitha hopes and dreams of being a very successful farmer.

loans.use: To hire laborers to assist with harvesting maize cob and to buy planting seeds

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 28-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. She started this business because she needed to create a permanent source of income to support the home.  

Kadiatu runs a food stand business: she sells flour, cooking oil, palm oil, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business seven days per week and twelve hours per day. Kadiatu says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient finances to expand her business and price inflation.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase food items like drinks, flour, cooking oil, palm oil, and cooking seasoning for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items like drinks, flour, cooking oil, palm oil, and cooking seasoning for resale

loans.name: Fatmata          T

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 23-year-old single woman from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown.  In 2006, she established a clothing business in a busy retail area.  She began her business because she wants to change her standard of living.  Fatmata  works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sales are very slow during the rainy season.

Fatmata requests a loan in order to purchase sandals, blouses and slacks for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and repay her loan. In the future, Fatmata plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, blouses and slacks for resale.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet Isata. She is a 36-year-old woman from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 1 child aged 17 years. Her child is currently attending school. 

For the past 9 years, Isata has established a clothing business within a busy market area. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation costs.

Isata requires a loan in order to purchase more blouses, trousers, and a variety of clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, Isata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more blouses, trousers, and a variety of clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, se decidió por otro crédito para comprar maíz, verduras y frutas, para sacar provecho en esta temporada navideña y tener más ingresos también de esta manera podrá fortalecer su negocio.
El efecto que le dio el crédito anterior fue muy positivo ya que su negocio creció, tiene una economía más estable y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado mucho.
texts.en:
María decided to request another loan in order to buy corn, vegetables, and fruits so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season and generate more income. This will also allow her to strengthen her business.

The effect of her previous loan was very positive since her business grew and provided a more stable financial situation. Her family circumstances greatly improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.name: Nyundo

texts.en:
Nyundo is a hard-working and enterprising man. He is married with four children, all of whom go to school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyundo operates a carpentry business, selling workshop tools such as pliers, hacksaws, nails and grease among others. He cites price fluctuation as his major challenge.

With the KES 15,000 loan he wants to purchase nails, paint, timber and workshop tools for his business. He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paint, timber and workshop tools for his business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has an Internet café business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional computer for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for three years now.

Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Gusinye Group

texts.en:
This group of three farmers is called Gusinye. It is a Nuru International group of farmers who are based in the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand is Josephat. He is 35 years old and married with five children who all go school. Josephat has been a member of the group since 2012 and he is the group’s chairperson.

Josephat has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase these farm inputs.

He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizers will increase his yield and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 35-year-old lady living with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She owns a general store at home; she has allotted a portion of her house for the general store. One of her drawing rooms opens through the front side in the street--she is utilizing that room for the general store. She offers many items such as rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. 

She has been running this business for many years and this is the major source of income for her family because her earnings are very poor. Now she wants to grow her business in increments for the needs of her family. So she decided to grow her business and contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan.

She will buy rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. She hopes that her general store would work better than earlier.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pulses, flour, and detergent for her general store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha, 45 years old, lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. There, the living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She is married and has a 30 year-old child. With a little money she got years ago, she established her business. She has been selling pepper, bitter ball, onion, salt, etc from a table for three years now. She spends six hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. She faces no major problem except limited income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, onion, salt, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, onion, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dayhanna Alexandra

texts.es:
Ella es dayhanna, siempre ha querido estudiar mercadeo y ventas, le ha sido muy difícil por motivos económicos ya que vive con la mama y los hermanos menores, Dayhanna con mucho esfuerzo logro matricularse para el curso de mercadeo y ventas, logro cursar el primer semestre, pero ya el segundo le fue imposible seguirlo hasta ahora que con esfuerzo puede seguir el curso para poder culminar el curso.
Dayhanna sueña con poder culminar el curso de mercadeo y ventas, quiere crecer  profesionalmente para poder cumplir las metas  y poder ayudarle a la mama con los hermanos, quiere colaborar con el estudio, no quiere que le pase lo mismo a los hermanos, quiere una buena educación que puedan estudiar sin complicaciones y san hombres de bien, porque la mama es la que responde por ellos y le es muy difícil darles una buena educación.
Dayhanna quiere en un futuro estar bien, ser una profesional, con un buen empleo, respondiendo por los hermanos, estudiando, saliendo adelante junto con la mama y que no pasen dificultades como lo tuvieron en el pasado, al igual dayhanna quiere seguir estudiando mercadeo y ventas, este curso es una buena ayuda para poder entrar a la universidad y seguir creciendo profesionalmente, necesita el convenio con kiva, ya que es un modo fácil de pagar las cuotas de su semestre.
texts.en:
This is Dayhanna. She has always wanted to study marketing and sales. It has been very difficult, however, due to financial reasons, since she still lives with her mother and younger brothers. With much effort Dayhanna was able to enroll in a marketing and sales course and to finish the first semester. However it was impossible for her to continue with the second semester and she is still trying to finish the program.

Dayhanna dreams of being able to finish her marketing and sales classes and wants to grow professionally so that she can meet her goals and be in a position to help her mother with her brothers. She wants to help them with their studies since she does not want the same thing to happen to them.  She wants them to have a good education and to study without complications and become fine, upstanding men. Her mother is the person who supports them and it is very difficult for her to provide a good education, as well.

Dayhanna wants to have a good future and to become a professional with a good job. Then she can help to support her brothers in their studies and she and her mother can get ahead together and avoid the problems that have plagued them in the past. As well Dayhanna wants to continue studying marketing and sales. This course is a good stepping stone to the university and to continuing to grow professionally. She needs this agreement with Kiva because it is an easy way to pay for her school semester.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother with four children, three are school-aged. She also takes care of additional family members (a mother and grandmother). She has been in the snack selling business for 2 years. Annet has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, baking powder and flour.  She generates additional income from teaching part time .  She works in a shop and sells wholesale seven days each week.  

Her major business challenges include increasing prices of cooking oil and other ingredients.  She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, baking powder, and flour.

loans.name: Alafia A Group

texts.en:
For the second time, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the “Alafia A” group. Their previous Kiva loan has been very helpful in boosting their respective businesses. 

Having done repaying their last Kiva loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each member in the group in order to further expand their respective businesses. 

Featured leader, Fatmata, will again use her share of the loan to buy rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, pepper, onions, gari (food made out of cassava roots), etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, pepper, onions, gari, etc.

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua is 41 years old and married. She and her husband have been blessed with four children.  Syombua has a fruit and vegetable business in Kangundo town.  Her spouse provides additional income for the family. 

She will use this loan to buy more mangoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to pay her children's school fees, repay the loan, and provide for the needs of her family. 

This is her second loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by opening a grocery shop to make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: María Lucia

texts.es:
María Lucia
Sarapiqui

La señora Marí¬a Lucia es una persona con una gran energía y deseos de implementar nuevos proyectos para mejorar la situación de ingresos del núcleo familiar. Ella es la cabeza de familia, un hijo pensionado por invalidez, le ayuda con la actividad de trabajo, mantenimiento y cuido de las tilapias y los pollos. El préstamo  anterior se financió para la compra de tilapias que  fueron arrasadas por una crecida en la quebrada cercana a las piletas. Este problema ya se solvente y se tienen listas para continuar con el desarrollo de las mismas.  Con respecto a los pollos se pretende aumentar su número y seguir así surtiendo una soda de familiares y vendiendo en la comunidad. Trabaja durante mucho tiempo como cocinera en las bananeras de donde obtuvo una pensión. 

Con el aporte de todos recibieron una capacitación e iniciaron con 500 tilapias, construyeron las piletas y compararon los implementos necesarios para el trabajo. Ante el crecimiento de los peces edificaron una pileta adicional y además como es la fase final desean cementarla y mejorar las condiciones de crianza de la misma para ofrecer su producto. Ya han vendido una cantidad pequeña a vecinos y a una hija que tiene un restaurante sobre la carretera principal. 

 La actividad se va a retomar, ya que por las circunstancias descritas anteriormente no se pudo continuar, ya se hicieron las mejoras en las piletas pero se requiere de capital para comprar las tilapias y alimento para su desarrollo. Ella manifiesta que se cuenta con la pensión para cubrir el pago de la cuota estipulada ante eventualidades como las ya explicadas. Además se va  a invertir en la crianza de pollos de engorde para tener otras fuentes de ingresos.

La propiedad cuenta con el terreno para desarrollo de la actividad, las piletas para las tilapias están acondicionadas para evitar crecidas de la quebrada y además se cuenta con los gallineros para la cría de los pollos. Se vive en un barrio poblado y existe  el potencial de venta del producto, además en las cercanías hay   establecimiento  donde el producto también es ofrecido.
texts.en:
María Lucia
Sarapiqui

Maria Lucia is a person with lots of energy and a desire to start her new projects for improving the family income.  She is the head of household and has a retired son due to being an invalid.  He helps her with the work of caring for the tilapias and chickens.  She used the money from the previous loan to buy tilapias which were destroyed by a flood in the nearby ravines.  This problem has been resolved and she is ready to continue.  She wants to increase her number of chickens and sell them in the community.  She has been working as a cook for a long time at the banana plantation from where she retired.

With everyone’s support they started with 500 tilapia, built the pools, and bought the necessary work supplies.  As a result of growth, she built an additional pool and would like to cement it in for the final phase so she can improve the raising conditions and offer a better product.  She has sold a small quantity to neighbors and to one of her daughters who has a restaurant on the main street.

The activity will resume, since it was not able to because of the earlier described situation.  She has made the improvements to the pools but needs capital to buy the tilapia and feed.  She says that she has a pension that will allow her to repay the loan and eventualities as described.  She will also buy chickens to raise so she can have another source of income.

There is enough land on which to develop this activity.  The tilapia pools are set up to prevent going broke and there are the chicken coups.  She lives in a populated neighborhood and there is a potential for sales.  There is also an establishment nearby where the product is also offered.

loans.use: to buy tilapia and feed.

loans.name: Soko A Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of seven farmers called Soko A. The group is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.
The person raising up his hand is Elias. He is 40 years old and married with six children. His children are all grown-ups. Elias has been a member of the group since 2012.
Elias has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rain seasons.  He is constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva so that he will be able to purchase these farm inputs. Elias believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields. He will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and invest in a business to obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees and other domestic uses.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Phillison's Group

texts.en:
Phillison is a member of Inama Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 40 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Phillison has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Phillison is married and has 5 children.  He is 46 years old and is known as a friendly and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and burial committee.  Phillison has been a farmer for 20 years.  Phillison described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Phillison first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Phillison joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and earn enough to feed family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, wants to help more farmers and also spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Phillison plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Phillison’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest and was able to feed the family.

Phillison and the Inama Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Marys Consuelo

texts.es:
Marys, es una señora que vive con su hija de 16 años de edad, es divorciada, no posee ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a vender ropa, es un oficio que aprendió de familia, tiene una experiencia de cuatro años en ese ámbito, lo hace de manera independiente, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:30 p.m.
Solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de surtir su inventario, comprará ropa, como blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, trajes para niños y niñas, espera que le ayude a tener clientes más satisfechos, brindar un buen servicio, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía para cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas.
Sueño con adquirir una casa propia y dar a su hija estudios universitarios, así como también una mejor vida familiar.
texts.en:
Marys is a lady who lives with her 16 year old daughter. She is divorced and cannot rely on anyone else for help. She sells clothing. It is a job she learned from her family. She has four years of experience and works independently. She works from 6 a.m. until 5:30 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to stock her inventory. She will buy clothing, such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts and outfits for boys and girls. She expects that it will help her have more satisfied clients, provide better service, increase sales and improve her finances so she can promptly repay her debts.

She dreams of owning a house and giving her daughter a university education and thus also improving her family life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Tas E Fi Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present this group of borrowers from Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have requested a loan of 800,000 SLL for each member in the group in order to boost their respective businesses both in size and quality. 

The featured leader is Marie, who is 57 years old. She is married to a trader and has six children who are attending primary and secondary school. Marie sells fish and has been a business woman for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 46-year-old married woman with eight children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nida has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business. She has been in this business for the past six years.She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years old and from Naivasha. She is married with two children.

Catherine has a hotel business that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy more chairs to add to her hotel.

She hopes to own the biggest hotel in her area.

loans.use: to enable her buy chairs to use in her hotel

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks like wallet, pouches, blankets, etc., to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like wallets, pouches, blankets, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Irma

texts.es:
Mercedes, es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, maíz y además tiene un molino de nixtamal, son actividades que prendió desde que era una  niña y se lo enseño su madre, ella vive con su esposo, un hijo y su mamá.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de maíz por mayor para las tortillas como para su venta, lo que le dará la oportunidad de aumentar su producción, tener más clientes y mejorar sus ganancias, con las cuales cancelara su deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
Aspira a tener un negocio lo suficientemente rentable para trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living selling tortillas and corn, and also operates a corn mill. She learned these activities from her mother when she was a girl. Mercedes lives with her husband, son and mother. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of corn at wholesale prices to make the tortillas that she sells. This will give her the opportunity to increase her production, reach more customers and improve her earnings, thus allowing her to pay back her debt and improve her family's lifestyle. Mercedes aspires to have a business that is profitable enough to work with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Fatma Dilek

texts.en: Fatma is divorced and has one child. Fifteen years ago she started making authentic embroidery inspired by Turkish themes as a hobby. She made bedspreads and covers for bedroom furniture. Later on she tried this embroidery on jewelry. She made various kinds of bracelets and rings. After a while she started her own business. She would get orders from her customers and sell her products. She improved her work and started making accessories for home decoration. When there were no orders, she continued to produce items and sold them wherever she went.  With the help of the loan she will buy various strings, demse strings (glow in the dark) and accessories.  Part of the loan will be used to create a website on which her products will be displayed. Her sales will increase because the number of accessories for her creations will increase. Right now she cannot buy anything because she does not have any capital. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy the items she needs and complete her orders and sell them. In the future, she wants to increase her capital and open a store. She wants to present her products to the public and also employ other women.  She wants to guarantee her child's future and enable her child to complete a full education. She also wants to found a trademark.

loans.use: to buy various strings, demse strings (glow in the dark) and accessories

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a 56-year-old from Nyandarua South. She is married with five children who are aged between 8 years and 20 years old.

She is a farmer and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm. 

She hopes to get a bigger loan and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 34 year old farmer who farms in Muranga area of Central Kenya.  He is married and has 2 school-aged children.  Farming has provided his livelihood for 5 years.  He produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, and a few small crops to sell in the local market. He enjoys dairy farming and milking the cows.

Lawrence chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer very good services, and provide loans at a low interest rate.  He also learned that in order to have economic growth, one must also develop a lifestyle of saving.  This loan will enable Lawrence to irrigate his crops because he will have a water tank to store enough water.  This will help his crops produce more and will increase his income base.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en:
Felecien is a 39-year-old father of six children. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to grown maize.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow maize.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has had a successful embroidery business in Kangundo town for 6 years. She makes and sells table and chair mats and it has been profitable. She is 38 years old, married and has been blessed with two children.

She will use this loan to buy embroidery materials and use them to make table mats to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more materials. 

This will be her second loan; she successfully repaid her previous loan. In the future, Lilian hopes to be successful in her business and improve her family's standard of  living.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 58-year-old lady and the mother of six children. One of her daughters owns a tailoring business at home and sews clothes for the ladies of her hometown. Her husband is an old man and does not do any job. 

Her daughter started the tailoring business as per the needs of her family. She uses a local sewing machine, which works manually and is very slow. Due to the low speed, she has lot of pending work to complete. Without a speedy machine, it seems impossible to sew clothes on time.

Therefore, Irshad requested a loan to buy a Juki sewing machine so that her daughter can sew clothes in a specific time. She expects that with the help of a new machine, she can complete her tasks in a very short time.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Hawa      M

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Hawa from Magburaka, Makeni Northern area, in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. 

In 2004, Hawa established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create a means of survival. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and a transportation problem.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Hawa plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is forty six years old, married to Laban, and a mother of five children. She sells second hand clothing in Kangemi and has been in this business for seven years. Her monthly income is eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Ruth's eight loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy clothes for resale, Ruth wants to improve her family's living standard in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
38-year-old Josephine lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia and Nimba County is the second-most populated county in Liberia. 

Josephine completed twelfth grade before starting her business. She is single and has four children, between 13 and 24 years old. With little money from her children's father, she managed to establish this business. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 12 hours per day. A problem she faces is low income.

Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase for her business, more palm oil, salt, meat, fish, onion, etc. Her plan is to one day build a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase for her business, more palm oil, salt, meat, fish, onion, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from Tandzut village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband and her elderly pensioner mother-in-law. To take care of the family's needs, Aida is extensively engaged in agribusiness with the help of her husband. They are involved in aviculture and in the cultivation of tomatoes, peppers, melons, watermelons, cherries and grapes. Aida and her husband sell their agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of income for the family. Both of them work really hard to be able to make ends meet. 

Aida cultivates plants in greenhouses and currently needs to make some investments in this sphere to be able to continue plant cultivation productively. A loan of $1,500 US will be huge support for this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase cellophane for the greenhouse, some fertilizers and special drugs for the plants, and fuel for the greenhouses. 

Aida and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support of this loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane for the greenhouse, some fertilizers and special drugs for the plants and fuel for the greenhouses

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en: Lyudmila is from the village of Dalarik of the Armavir region. She lives with her daughter. Lyudmila is employed in the government sector; she is an emergency nurse. Her salary, however, is so low that she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To cover her family's costs, Lyudmila, with the help of her daughter, is also engaged in breeding a livestock of steers and piglets. As life is getting more expensive with time, Lyudmila wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to more effectively address her family's needs. A loan of 1,300 USD will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase two steers, to buy some forage for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments. Lyudmila and her daughter rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain her agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two steers, to buy some forage for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Felix's Group

texts.en:
Felix is a member of the Bidii farmers Group in the Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of nine One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 71 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Felix has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Felix is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with five children.  Felix is 45 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last five years to support his family.  In addition to this, Felix is involved in the prayer group.  He described his harvest last year as one not with One Acre Fund.  He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!							

Felix is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rain season. Felix joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative.  Felix plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Felix’s own life was improved because he has more farm training.  	
						
Felix and the Bidii farmers Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
	
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is 26 years old, married, and has a child. Now he lives with his family in the Baku region. His wife is a housewife; she take care her baby. Anar has been a master for five years. He builds and repairs homes and walls of yard. Today Anar needs a loan amount of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy equipment, stone, etc. He has applied for a loan from the Komak company. Anar hopes that this loan will be better for his business. He is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for their help. In the future he wants to hire an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: he wants to buy equipments, stone, etc

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, a 35-year-old married father of two babies, has been working in aluminum-manufacturing for 18 years. A Palestinian refugee, he started this kind of work to support his parents. In December of 2012, Mohamad established his current business, and he is working hard to develop it properly to improve his socioeconomic situation.

Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy an important newly released aluminum-pressing machine. He is looking forward to acquiring it in order to develop his business and reply faster to customers' needs and requests. This will reflect positively on his family's socioeconomic situation.

Mohama hopes to keep on developing his business and will work hard to recruit someone to help him when business increases.

loans.use: To buy an important newly released aluminum pressing machine

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat is 39 years old and married, with three children. Her husband is a bus driver. One of her children is a student of University; another child is 15 years old and goes to ninth class, and the third goes to seventh class. 

Matanat has been in sheep breeding for a long time. Matanat buys lambs, raises them, and sells them to the butcher to earn money. Today she needs AZN 2,300 to buy more lambs for her business. 

Matanat says she is thankful to the partner of Komak company, the Kiva organization, for the aid. In the future she wants to build a new and big stall to  increase her business and monthly income.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

loans.name: Pathmos Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Bufole est une commerçante avec une expérience de 4 ans et leader d’un groupe d’Affaires « Pathmos ». La cliente est  senior, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 étudient et 5 autres enfants sont déjà  mariés et responsables de leurs foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de boissons sucrées.  Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de l’IMF Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 9 casiers de boissons sucrées (Fanta, coca). Son conjoint est un chauffeur auprès d’une compagnie commerciale. Elle avait commencé son entreprise avec le fonds (prêt) reçu de l’IMF Hekima. Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur donnant de crédit sans garantie matérielle,  surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bufole is a merchant with four years' experience and the leader of the "Pathmos" group. She is a senior, aged 50, and a mother of nine children, of whom four go to school. The other five children are already married and responsible for their own households. Her husband is a driver with a commercial company. 

Bufole sells soft drinks. She started this business with a loan that she received from the micro-finance institution Hekima. [Now] she is seeking a loan with Hekima to increase her business. She is going to buy nine cases of soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-cola).

Bufole would like to see her children educated.

She thanks Hekima for their support to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional financial services by providing loans without requiring collateral, especially during this time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy nine cases of soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-cola)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Doña Anita es una mujer con 48 años de edad, divorciada y madre de dos varones. Actualmente vive en unión libre con otro compañero y un hijo. Es una clienta muy trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Humilde, simpática y con muchos deseos de crecer y superarse. Se dedica al comercio hace muchos años y ahora solicita por segunda vez un financiamiento a la Fundación para reforzar su negocio. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en las decisiones a tomar con respecto a su actividad. Ella vende oro, y también por catálogo, pero ésta vez busca reforzar la actividad de la venta de oro, debido que para ésta época tiene muchos encargos. Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para generar más ingresos y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: Anita is a 48 year old woman who is divorced and the mother of two young men. She currently lives in a common law marriage with another partner and a child. She is a very hard worker and she has a vision for business. She is humble, friendly and has a lot of desire to grow and to succeed. She has worked on her business for many years and now she is seeking, for the second time, a financing from the Fundación to reinforce her business. She counts on the support of her family when she makes decisions regarding her work. She sells gold, and also items by catalogue, but this time she seeks to reinforce her gold sales business because at this time she has many orders. Her goal is to work hard to obtain more earnings and by this means improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase gold.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard, 52 years old, has been a maize farmer for the past three years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to increase his maize production. Gaspard wishes to reinvest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Santos Medardo

texts.es:
Santos, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos para su tienda, como variedad de bebidas, golosinas, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, sal, etc., con lo que tendrá variedad de productos para seguir teniendo satisfechos a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior Santos, fortaleció su tienda adquiriendo variedad de productos con los que aumento sus ventas, tiene mayor rentabilidad, con lo que ha salido de sus deudas y da a su familia mejores oportunidades de desarrollo social y económico.
texts.en:
Santos has decided to apply for a new loan to buy supplies for his store, the goods being a variety of drinks, sweets, beans, corn, oil, sugar, salt and so on, this means that he will have a variety of products to continue satisfying his customers.

With the previous loan, Santos bolstered his store, buying a variety of products with which he increased his sales. He has a better profitability, through which he has got out of debt and gives his family better opportunities for social and economic development.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 59 years old and from Nyandarua South. She is married and has big children who are all married. 

Rosemary has a boutique that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock. 

She hopes to expand her business and be able to open another boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her boutique.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 32 years old and from Naivasha. She is single but supports one child who is seven years old and in school. She has a retail shop that she has been running for many years.

Carol is applying for a 20,000 KES loan, her first from Vision Fund Kenya. The loan will enable her to buy milk, soap, cooking fat, etc. to add to her stock. She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy milk, soap, cooking fat, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 48 years old and married with nine children. With two children currently in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, noodles, etc. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María, continúa fortaleciendo su venta de tamales, por lo que opta por crédito para comprar leña, maíz, pollo, verduras y aceite, pues son su materia prima para trabajar y seguir teniendo sus ingresos económicos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, a tener nuevos clientes,una cosecha abundante, aumentar ventas y tener mejores ganancias, con las que cancela las cuotas y mejora su situación familiar. También ha empezado a vender tamales para tener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
María continues to build her tamale sales, which is why she is applying for a loan to buy firewood, corn, chicken, vegetables and oil, since they are the raw materials for her to work and continue having an income.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business, to have new customers, an abundant harvest, increase sales and have better earnings, with which she makes her payments and improves her family situation. She has also started selling tamales to have extra income.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, chicken, vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en:
This is a 29-year-old businesswoman who lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and Nimba County is the second-largest populated county in Liberia. 

Albertha stopped her education at fourth grade before establishing her business. She is unmarried with three children aged between 2 and 9. Only two are in school and live at home. 

For over two years, she has been running a table in the local market selling rice and oil. She spends eight hours each day on her business. Some problem she faces is a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. 

Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, se decidió por un nuevo crédito debido a los buenos beneficios que obtiene, en está ocasión comprará flores, listones, espumas florales, globos, que son parte de los materiales que utiliza para realizar el servicio de decoraciones y venta de accesorios para eventos. Ya que esta época de graduaciones escolares sus servicios tienen una mayor demanda.
Con la inversión del capital anterior le ayudo a tener un negocio fortalecido para enfrentar la demanda de sus clientes, sus ingresos han mejorado, su número de clientes a crecido la calidad de vida ha mejorado y sigue luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis has decided to apply for a new loan given the good profits he makes. On this occasion, he will buy flowers, ribbons, floral foam and balloons which are some of the materials that he uses for decorations and the sale of accessories for events, as this is the moment of school graduations, demand for his services has increased. 

The investment from the previous loan helped Luis to have a business that was strong in the face of demand from his customers, his sales have risen, the number of customers has grown, his quality of life has improved and he continues to fight to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy flowers, ribbons, floral foam and balloons.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a resident of the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband's name is Jagodish and they have two children: a five-year-old son and two-year-old daughter. Purnima is a homemaker. Instead of working, she has always stayed at home looking after the children. She attended school up to class X (Grade 10). Her husband received education up to class VIII (Grade 8). One of their children, the son, reads in class I ( Grade 1). They have a kachha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw).

Purnima's husband works on their own land where he grows seasonal vegetables. The products are sold at the local market. In this way, he earns a livelihood for their family. Despite his hard work, his earnings don't stretch far enough to live. So Purnima has decided to stretch out her helping hands to her husband. She thought of starting potato cultivation on their land. She applied for loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc., for cultivating potatoes. As potatoes are in great demand in their local market and in the present time, their hope is that this business will be a lucrative one and will increase their earnings and generate the money they need to support their family.

Purnima's dream is to make a pakka house (concrete-made) with the profit generated. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes and selling them in the market.

loans.name: Lili

texts.fr: Lili est une jeune femme de 21 ans fiancée, mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 1 et 8 ans. deux de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis 4ans déjà. Elle souhaiterait acheter un centenaire pour sécuriser son activité parce que son salon est construit avec en planche et aussi améliorer son cadre. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Lili is a young 21-year-old engaged woman and a mother of three children, who age from one to eight years old. Two of her children are already in school.

After her training, Lili opened a hair salon, which she has already been running now for four years. 

She would like to buy a container to secure her [equipment], because her salon is built with planks. She would also like to improve her salon.

Her goal is to satisfy her customers and earn more.

Earnings from this loan will help her to met her needs, those of her children, and also to save in order to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a container

loans.name: Business Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Business Group. They are from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 3,700,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. The 34-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have two children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells food ingredients, including onions, pepper, fish, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), and margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy food ingredients in bulk, to add to her current stock.
