loans.use: to buy food ingredients in bulk, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, a 21-year-old single man from the city of Rafah, lives with his family in a small simple house. For the past five years, Ibrahim has been working in a small grocery shop his family owns. It is a good business that earns a good income. 

Ibrahim would like to develop the store and so requested this USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy more products to resell. This will help to increase the enterprise's profitability.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 24 years old and single from a small village called Tubas near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

For the past year, Hasan has been working in the small grocery shop his family owns. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Hasan would like to develop his store and put more products on it, but they don't have enough money for it. 

Hasan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, the store will be in a better condition, and its productivity will increase.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Aganza Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Margu est une commerçante avec une expérience dans les affaires de 15 ans et conseillère d’une Association d’Affaires « Aganza ». La cliente est  senior, âgée de 50 ans, divorcée et mère de 3 enfants dont 1 étudie et 2 autres enfants sont déjà mariés et responsables de leurs foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de l’IMF Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 3 sacs de poissons salés. Elle avait commencé son entreprise dans sa jeunesse avec le fonds reçu de son petit ami. Elle souhaite construire sa maison et scolariser son enfant. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes d’affaires non bancables en leur donnant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Margu is a merchant with fifteen years of experience in business and advisor for the "Aganza" group. She is a senior 50-year-old woman, divorced, and a mother of three children. One child goes to school while the other two are already married and responsible for their own households. 

Margu sells fish. Margu started this business when she was younger with money received from her partner. She is seeking a loan with the micro-finance institution Hekima in order to increase her business. She is going to buy three sacs of salted fish. 

Margu would like to build a house and educate her child. She thanks Hekima for their support to businesswomen who lack access to financial services by providing loans without requiring collateral, especially during this time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of salted fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Daglio Ulises

texts.es:
Daglio, se dispone a recolectar la cosecha de maíz, por lo que nuevamente está solicitando un nuevo crédito para pagar mano de obra y un maquina desgranadora, lo que le facilitara contar con su producción en menor tiempo y así cumplir con los diferentes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Con el capital que se le facilito antes le ayudo a comprar los insumos con los que prepararía la tierra para sembrar maíz, aumento su producción, sus granos son mejor calidad, sus ingresos han mejorado. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Daglio is ready to harvest his corn and so is applying for a new loan to pay for labourers and to buy a machine that separates grain from the rest of the plant. This machine will speed up the production process and Daglio will be able to fulfil the various orders from his customers.

Daglio's previous loan helped him to buy supplies with which he could prepare the earth in order to sow corn.  He increased production, his grains were of a higher quality, and his income has increased.  Daglio's family is in very good health.

loans.use: to pay for labourers and to buy a machine that separates grains from their plants.

loans.name: Favour Ii Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from members of the "Favour II" group. Members of the "Favour II" group are very pleased to inform you that their just-repaid Kiva loan has been very helpful in boosting the sizes and qualities of their respective businesses. 

Having finished repaying that loan very successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to further invest in their respective businesses. 

Hawa is again the featured leader of this group. Like before, Hawa is again going to use her share of the loan to buy sardines, sugar, sweets, milk, cigarettes, candles, books, pens, soaps, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

(Also attached in the right of the group photo is a thumbnail image of a group member who was not present for the group photo).

loans.use: to purchase sardines, sugar, sweets, milk, cigarettes, candles, books, pens, soaps, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Humberto Mario

texts.es:
Humberto, se le ha presentado la necesidad de invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo a sus clientes, son está adquisición su negocio estará fortalecido y contara con la satisfacción de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior compro ganado, lo que le dio la facilidad de fortalecer su negocio, tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas, y tener mejores ganancias, las cuales han sido utilizadas en cancelar la deuda y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Humberto finds himself in need of investment for his business and so is applying for another loan in order to buy cattle to fatten up and sell to his customers.  With this loan, his business will be stronger and Humberto's customers will be satisfied.  

Humberto used his previous loan to buy cattle, which made his business stronger, gave him more customers, and increased his sales and income.  This higher income was used to pay off his debt and to improve his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late thirties, is single with two children who are still at school. She has operated a cosmetics business for three years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy cosmetics which were in demand and pay off her loan. She used her profits to pay school fees, buy a plot of land and cover household expenses. She is doing fine and really appreciates that loan.

Joyce is applying for a 5,600,000 TZS loan to share with the two other members who comprise her group named Kilombero. The three members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Joyce will use her portion of the loan to buy different types of cosmetics to meet her customer's demands. She dreams of building her own house on the plot of land she bought.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Eder

texts.es: Eder, tiene 21 años, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos porque espera consolidarse económicamente para formar su propia familia, actualmente vive en casa de su abuela junto a ella, su padre y su hermano. Eder trabaja como conductor de mototaxi, su trabajo consiste en trasladar a los pasajeros a su destino de manera rápida y segura, siempre regalando en su trayecto una gran sonrisa y una amena conversación, de ésta forma todas las personas que solicitan su servicio terminan muy contentos y agradecidos por el trato amable que ofrece y por que cobra el precio justo por su trabajo, sin realizar cobros exagerados. Lleva en ésta actividad un poco más de 2 años, trabaja solo y a diario renueva sus energías para trabajar con mucho optimismo y siempre dando lo mejor de sí para que al final del día pueda ver que el fruto de su esfuerzo se ha reflejado en buenos ingresos económicos. Por lo pronto, le gusta la actividad que realiza, aunque asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar como mototaxista porque tenía que enfrentar los comentarios negativos de las personas, y porque no conocía la ciudad completamente, ahora realiza su trabajo de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado, espera algún día tener un amplia flota vehicular. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. El monto solicitado lo usará para pagar su segunda cuota que le permitirá obtener un mototaxi nuevo con el cual espera seguir trabajando con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Eder is 21 years old, single and still does not have children, because he hopes to become established financially before starting his own family. He currently lives in his grandmother's house with her, his father and his brother.

Eder works as a motorcycle taxi driver. His work consists of transporting passengers to their destination in a fast, safe manner, always with a smile and pleasant conversation. This way, everyone who asks for his service ends up very happy and grateful for the friendly treatment that he offers and because he charges a fair price for his work, without asking for excessive payment.

He has been in this business for a little over 2 years. He works alone, and everyday he renews his energy to work with a lot of optimism, always giving the best of himself so that at the end of the day, he can see the fruits of his labor reflected in good economic returns.

For the moment, he likes the business that he is in, although he says that in the beginning it was difficult for him to work as a motorcycle taxi driver because he had to face negative comments from people, and because he didn't know the city completely. Now he does his work in an optimum fashion, and his income has increased. He hopes one day to have a large vehicular fleet.

On this occasion, he is applying for S/ 1000, and thanks whoever makes his loan possible so that he can continue with his goals. On the other hand, he is very committed to making his payments on time.

He will use the requested amount to make his second rental payment, which will allow him to get a new motorcycle taxi, with which he hopes to continue working in greater comfort.

loans.use: to pay for his motorcycle-taxi.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María, es acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijas, como motivación propia hace mucho tiempo fundo una tienda en su casa, en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, la atiende de 6:30 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., es apoyada por sus hijas.
Mejorar su inventario con productos nuevos y a buen precio, por lo que solicita capital para comprar jabón, detergentes, pastas, bebidas, golosinas, pan, y granos básicos. Con lo que tendrá un aumento en sus ventas, nuevos clientes y mejores ingresos.
María sueña con tener los recursos económicos para que una de sus hijas culmine su carrera universitaria y también mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María has a partner - she lives with him and her three daughters. María opened a store in her house a long time ago, with her own motivation. María sells basic necessities in her store, working from 6.30am until 8pm. She receives support from her daughters.

María wants to improve her store by offering new stock and so she is applying for a loan in order to buy soap, detergents, pasta, soft drinks, sweets, bread and basic grains. With this loan her sales will increase, and she will have new customers and a higher income.

María dreams of having enough money for one of her daughter's to complete university and also to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, pasta, soft drinks, sweets, bread and basic grains.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, solicita capital para invertir en la venta de comida ya que en estas fechas  los vacacionistas aumentan y para aprovechar la época surtirá con los insumos necesarios al negocio, comprara carnes, arroz, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, bebidas  y verduras para continuar elaborando la variedad de comida que ofrece.
María se siente satisfecha con los efectos positivos que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, pues con facilidad fortaleció su negocio  y se ha mantenido vendiendo comida, sus ventas aumentaron y sus ganancias son mejores con las cuales ha cancelado sus cuotas y mejoro el estilo familiar.
texts.en:
María is applying for a loan to invest in food as, during these end of year festivities, sales increase. In order to take advantage of the season, María will stock up on necessary supplies for her business: she will buy meat, rice, oil, pork, cream-cheese tortillas, vegetables and soft drinks.

María is satisfied with the positive results of her previous loan. She was able to strengthen her business and has continued selling food.  Her sales increased and her higher profits allowed her to pay off her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil, pork, cream-cheese tortillas, vegetables and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, es una madre que ha tendido que ingeniárselas para poder a sus tres hijos lo necesario para crecer en un ambiente sano, las edades de sus hijos son 8, 5 años de edad y uno de un mes de nacido, ella es soltera, para obtener los ingresos instalo una pupuseria y venta de antojitos en su residencia, es un oficio que aprendió de su madre, ya cuenta con cinco años de experiencia.
Necesita el crédito para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, harina, aceite, tomates, repollo y aderezos, ya que son su materia prima para trabajar en su negocio, espera tener un servicio, atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar ventas y mejorar su economía.
Anhela aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio para ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro con mejores oportunidades en su educaión.
texts.en:
Ana is a mother who has had to be inventive in order to give her children everything they need to be able to grow up in a healthy environment.  Ana has three children, the eldest two are eight and five years old each, and the youngest is one month old. Ana is single and in order to earn an income, she has a stall at her home selling stuffed corn tortillas and snacks.  She learned this work from her mother and now has five years of experience.

Ana needs this loan in order to buy tortillas with cream cheese filling, pork, flour, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, and dressing, the basic supplies that she needs to work.  Ana hopes to offer good service, attract new customers, increase her sales, and improve her financial situation.

Ana longs to increase the profitability of her business in order her children a future with better educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy tortillas with cream cheese filling, pork, flour, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, and dressing.

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore is the divorced mother of a 24-year-old.  Her 28-year-old son passed away about a year ago. With him passing away, she literally struggled, emotionally and financial wise. She did not work for an entire year, because the grief was enormous, according to her.

“I could not stop crying outloud; everywhere and every time. I was devastated. I wanted to die, too. I would spend the entire day at the cemetery, talking to him and taking care of the flowers on his grave. People in my community and my family provided me with adequate emotional help and here I am now trying to move on,” said Vitore.

Vitore has owned a photo shop for the past 18 years and now wants to add some more equipment to it. The shop is located in a town; thus, it has built a large clientele throughout the years.

This loan will be her first one.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her photo shop

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, como toda una buena vendedora sabe que en estas fiestas navideñas y de fin de año la afluencia de compradores aumentan por esa razón está solicitando capital para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, espera cubrir las demandas de los compradores y tener ingresos mayores.
Para ella el préstamo anterior le facilito tener nuevas y mejores prendas para que sus clientes mantengan su fidelidad, su economía ha mejorada mucho y con ello ha cancelado sus cuotas y mejoro el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Like any good saleswoman, María knows that sales increase during the end of year festivities and, so, she is applying for a loan to invest in a variety of clothing items for men, woman and children. She hopes that she will cover demand and earn a higher income.

María's previous loan helped her to offer new and better clothing items so that her customers would remain loyal.  María's financial situation has greatly improved and, with it, she has paid off her loan and improved her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items for men, women and children.

loans.name: Emmanuel Queens Group

texts.en: Jane, the group leader for Emmanuel Group is operating a grocery shop in Mutare. She has been doing this business for more than five years and mainly deals with groceries.  She wants to use her part of the loan of $400 to buy sugar, cooking oil and chicken cuts for resale in her business. Other group members are in the business of buying and selling electrical goods.  She is a married woman with three children, two of whom go to school.The challenge she has been facing is that some clients do not pay debts on time.

loans.use: buy sugar, cooking oil, chicken cuts and salt for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County. (This county is rich in natural resources, has better living conditions than in the capital city, and is the second largest populated county in Liberia.) Mary did not go to school before establishing her business, and she has lived all her life in rural areas. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have four children, whose ages are between 10 to 24. All of their children are in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years, Mary has been running a table where she sells palm oil, vita (a juice drink), pepper, and salt in the local market. She spends nine hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, vita, pepper, and salt for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, vita (a juice drink), pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her family consists of three sons and three daughters. Her husband is a barber by profession. He is an expert in his skills and provides services in his community market. All of his customers appreciate his work. Ramzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BARC Pakistan for her husband to purchase variety of scissors, a mirror and a revolving chair for the salon. 
She hopes that that loan would be helpful for her husband to work more professionally. 

Ramzana wishes to provide a quality education for her children. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of scissors, a mirror and a revolving chair for salon.

loans.name: Rehan

texts.en:
Rehan is 47 years old. She is a widow and lives with one child in the Baku region. Her husband died of war in Kharabakh.  Today she is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Zangilan city for already 21 years. Her son is studying at the fourth course of college. 

Rehan is a cook.  She makes national dishes like “xingal,” “dusbere,” “eriste,” “gurze,” etc.  

Now she needs a loan amount of AZN 2,300 to buy a new fridge, plates, and dishes. Therefore she has applied to the Komak company for the loan. 

Rehan is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for the loan. In the future she wants to improve her business, and in personal life she wants her son to get engaged.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge, plates, and dishes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (father). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through roasting maize. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because it was reaching out to the bottom poor. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the single mother of three children; all her children go to school. She also takes care of her brother's children. 

She has a business of selling fruits and vegetables like sweet bananas, tomatoes, and onions. She has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas and boxes of tomatoes and onions. She generates additional income from selling charcoal.  

She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her business challenges includes seasonality and thieves, 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, buying a plot of land to build a house, and also starting to grow some of those vegetables.  

She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas and boxes of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, opta por un nuevo crédito para adquirir hilo y pagara hamacas, con lo que elabora más hamacas y cancelará a las hamacas a las personas que le colaboran en esta  actividad, ya que está época del año es cuando las ventas aumentan.
Con el crédito anterior expandió su negocio, aumentaron sus ventas, su economía ha mejorado y le ha permitido cubrir los pagos de sus cuotas y seguir aportando en los gastos familiares. Su familia junto con ella por el momento se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Ana decided to seek a new loan to buy thread to make more hammocks and to pay for the hammocks that the people working with her in this activity have made, given that this is the time of year in which sales increase.

With the previous loan, she expanded her business, her sales increased, her finances improved and it allowed her to cover her repayments and continue contributing to the family expenses. Together with her family, Ana is in a very healthy situation.

loans.use: to buy threads and pay for hammocks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 48 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy emprendedora, es una mujer que no tiene miedo a las dificultades que le pone el destino, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos y vive solo con uno de ellos y su pequeño nieto en su casa propia, en donde todos los días comparten el mismo entusiasmo por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Gloria consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, se encarga de realizar sus propios diseños, además realiza la refacción de otras prendas que le solicitan sus clientes ya que confían en que ella hará un muy buen trabajo, tiene un taller pequeño en su casa y desde ahí realiza toda su labor, se inició en su trabajo hace 8 años, empezó realizando trabajos simples y la experiencia que ha obtenido en todo este tiempo ahora le permiten crear prendas mas complejas dándoles un buen acabado y detalles personalizados, trabaja sola y esta mas que contenta porque desempeña la actividad que le gusta. Le esta yendo muy bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes quienes la buscan muy a menudo, al principio se sentía de poca utilidad en su casa pero decidió emprender algún negocio y ahora está muy contenta porque su labor le ha permitido realizar su vida con cierta tranquilidad, ahora desea trabajar mas para hacer crecer su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para seguir con su trabajo como telas, hilos, elásticos y moldes de ropas para confeccionar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Gloria, 48 years old, us a good, friendly and very entrepreneurial woman. She is a woman who isn't afraid of the difficulties that fate brings her. 

She is married and has five children, but lives alone with one of them and her little grandson in her own home, where every day she shares the same enthusiasm for getting ahead and having a better quality of life.

Gloria's work is tailoring clothing. She handles her own designs and also handles alterations for other garments her clients ask for. They trust her, as she does very good work. She has a small workshop in her house and does all her work from there.

She started her work eight years ago, beginning with completing simple projects. The experience she has acquired in this time now allows her to create more complicated garments, giving them a good finish and personalized details.

She works along is and is more then happy because she does the activity she likes. Her business is going very well, as she has many customers who seek her out very often. At first, she felt of little use in her home but she decided to start a business and is now very happy because her work has allowed her to live her live with a certain calmness. 

This time, she is taking for a loan of S/. 1200. She thanks the people who are providing the loan which she needs to increase her working capital and she promises to pay her dues punctually. With the amount she is asking for, she will buy materials to continue with her work, such as fabrics, threads, elastics and clothing molds.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabrics, threads, elastics and clothing molds.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 57-year-old Mabinty from Magburaka, Makeni, a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is widowed, with five children. 

In 1985, Mabinty established her timber business. She began her business because she wanted to create a source of income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more timber for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and to increase her business. 

In the future, Mabinty plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Vincia Mae

texts.en:
Vincia Mae is 21 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Vincia Mae has been fattening pigs for two years and earns additional income from a general store.

Vincia Mae is borrowing 9000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Haruni's Group

texts.en:
Baraka is a group of 7 farmers in Kakamega North District with Haruni selected as the Kiva representative. Haruni has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 64 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Haruni is married and has three children.  He is 39 years old and is known as hardworking. He is active in his community in groups such as the women's group, and prayer group. Haruni has been a farmer for 25 years. Haruni described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  
							
Haruni first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Haruni joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers.  Haruni plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Haruni’s own life was improved because he was able to feed the family. 

Haruni and the Baraka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
	
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Heros

texts.en:
Heros is from Gogaran village of Lori region. He is married and is a father of three little children (his wife and two children are in the photo).

Heros has been involved in an agribusiness for over five years. He keeps livestock: cows, sheep and chickens. He also cultivates wheat, potatoes and grass. Heros is a very hardworking young man who does his best to sustain his family's living conditions. His wife is hardly managing to take care of their three little children so Heros is the only breadwinner of the family. During the winter season Heros also goes to a neighboring country and little by little supports his family financially. 

Heros took a loan from a local financial institution before but wasn't able to pay it back on time, because of the family's poor living conditions. Now, thanks to his tireless and devoted work, Heros is perfectly managing to cover his family's daily needs and successfully runs his farm. With this loan that he is asking for, Heros would like to purchase a cow and five sheep. This loan will help Heros to be ready for the coming winter cold months. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and five sheep.

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es:
Santos, está acompañado, vive solo con su compañera de vida, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, se dedica a siembra de granos básicos, realiza sus labores de siembra de maíz y frijol de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., lo hace de forma independiente y es un oficio que aprendió de su padre. 
Invertirá en la recolección de la cosecha, pagara mozos que le ayuden y el transporte de la cosecha hacia su casa, espera recolectar su cosecha a tiempo y de esa manera tener listos los granos en menor tiempo para ofrecerlos a sus clientes, incrementar sus ganancias con lo que cancelara sus cuotas.
Sueña con mejorar su economía para tener los ingresos necesarios para hacerle reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos is in a couple, lives only with his life partner, and does not have relations abroad. He makes his living sowing bulk grains; he sows corn and beans from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m., doing this independently and it is a profession he learned from his father.

Santos will invest in the harvesting of the crop; he will hire laborers to help him and to ship the crop to his home. He hopes to collect the produces in time and in this manner have the grains ready in less time to offer to his customers, as well as increase his profits with which he will repay his loan. He dreams of improving his finances to have the income needed to repair his home.

loans.use: to invest in harvesting the crop.

loans.name: Flaubert

texts.en: Flaubert is a thirty-four-year-old Cameroonian. He is married, with two children. The older child is five in primary school, while the younger is two years old. He has been in this business for over six years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help him to increase his monthly profit by forty percent. His standard of living will also be improved.

loans.use: to buy a better shaver

loans.name: Farmayil

texts.en:
Fermayil is 53 years old and lives in the Baku region. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Fermayil’s older daughter is married. His son is studying his third course in college and his younger daughter is in seventh grade. 

Fermayil rents a store and sells different toys, including cars, puzzles, and puppets. He loves little children and therefore loves his job. He wants to expand his lovely business and start selling children's clothes. Therefore, he is applying for a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) loan from Komak. With this loan, he will purchase a variety of baby clothes. 

Fermayil thanks Komak, Kiva, and Kiva lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of children's clothes to sell at his store

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio tiene 40 años, es casado con Rufina y vive junto a sus 4 hijos en su casa propia hecha a base de madera. Hace mas de 26 años se dedica a la reparación de vehículos menores como motos lineales, moto carguero y similares. Se inicio en este oficio porque desde muy joven fue ayudante en diversos talleres donde adquirió los conocimientos necesarios y lograr con el paso de los años independizarse con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos y mantener económicamente a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con un taller en un local que alquila y donde recibe la visita de distintos clientes ya que en su localidad abundan estos vehículos que benefician su labor. Con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos logró implementar en su taller una pequeña tienda de repuestos donde se auto provee permitiéndole obtener ganancias adicionales paralelo a su labor como mecánico.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y lubricantes  al por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 40 years old and married to Rufina. They live together with their 4 children in their own wooden house. For 26 years now he has repaired small vehicles such as motorcycles, cargo cycles, and other similar vehicles. Dionisio took up this work because since very young, he has been an assistant in diverse shops where he acquired the necessary knowledge. With the passage of the years, he gradually become independent, in order to obtain better income for supporting his family. 

At present, Dionisio rents a shop in a local market where his distinct customers can find him and where there are lots of such vehicles that require his labor. With the objective of obtaining better income, he has established within his workshop a small replacement parts store where customers can buy parts, permitting him to earn additional money parallel to his work as a mechanic.

This is Dionisio's 1st Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial aid he is receiving to continue ahead. In addition, he promises to make his payments punctually. He wishes, on this occasion, to borrow 3,000 new sols for purchasing replacement parts and lubricants at wholesale to re-supply his business.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and lubricants for his business.

loans.name: Agness' Group

texts.en:
Mamboleo is a group of 6  farmers in Chwele District with Agness selected as their Kiva representative.  Agness has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Agness is 45 years old and has been a farmer for 13 years. she works as a farmer to provide for her 7 children.  The community and other farmers know Agness as friendly and an experienced.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community, with the women's group and burial committee for example.  Agness described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Agness joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Agness joined One Acre Fund so that she could get  access new farming methods to earn enough to feed family.  Because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers, Agness has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved her life because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, and was able to save money.  In the future, Agness hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and invest in a business.
  							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Agness and the Mamboleo Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left side of the photo.

loans.use: to support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase their harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 34 years old. He has spent ten years in maize production, and he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise is 34 years old. She is a widow who takes care of four children. They all go to school. She would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 37-year-old married woman from a small village near Gaza city. She lives with her husband and son in a small humble house. For the past three years, Nisreen's husband has been working in a small grocery shop he owns. it is a good business and his shop is located in a very good area in the city. Nisreen and her husband would like to develop their store and put more products on it but they don't have enough money for it. 

Nisreen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to expand their grocery shop and put up more shelves. By taking this loan, the store will be in a better condition and its productivity will increase.

Nisreen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand their grocery shop and put up more shelves.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from the Isahakyan village, where he lives with his parents. Edgar has become the only breadwinner in his family after his father got retired. Currently he does his best to provide minimum living conditions for his parents. 

Edgar is a farmer. He owns a plot of land where wheat is grown. He also keeps livestock of chickens, pigs and piglets. 

Edgar feels very responsible to take care of the farm, which is the only source of family's income. So by applying for this loan, Edgar asks financial support to purchase two oxen, fertilizer, and seeds for cultivation. 

Since this is the first loan for Edgar, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Edgar hopes that the loan will bring for him a success to enlarge his farm and ensure a better life for his parents.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen, fertilizer, and seeds for cultivation of the land

loans.name: Glenda Marilu

texts.es:
Glenda, vive una casa familiar junto a su hijo y su compañero de vida, en busca de apoyar con los gastos de su familia inicio a trabajar con una amiga, hoy en día tiene un año en el que se dedica a vender ropa y productos de belleza de forma independiente.
Comprará variedad de ropa y productos de belleza, tales como camisas, blusas, trajes y pantalones para damas, caballeros y niños, también adquirirá cremas corporales, labiales, sombras, etc., con lo que su negocio se verá fortalecido para estas temporadas de fin de año, espera aumentar sus ventas, incrementar los ingresos, y salir de sus deudas.
Sueña con mejorar su economía, tener un negocio más amplio, seguir aportando en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Glenda lives in a family home together with her son and life partner. In seeking a manner to help with her family's expenditure, she started to work with a friend. Today she has been selling clothes and beauty products in an independent manner for one year now.

She will buy a variety of clothes and beauty products such as shirts, blouses, suits and trousers for men, women and children. She will also buy body creams, lipsticks, eye shadows and so on, with which to strengthen her business for the end-of-year season. She hopes to increase her sales, grow her sales and get out of her debts. 

She dreams of improving her finances, having a larger business, and continuing to support the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: María ha trabajado durante los últimos 20 años en su propio negocio, un pequeño quiosco donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, alimentos fritos, mecato, gaseosas, entre otros, se encuentra ubicada al lado de un parqueadero de buses, por lo que sus principales clientes son los conductores de la zona, trabaja sola todos los días desde muy temprano en las mañanas, así genera los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia, conformada por su esposo y 3 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito que será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, arroz, pollo, gaseosas, mecato, entre otros) y realizar adecuaciones locativas (cambiar el lavaplatos), eso le permitirá tener disponibilidad de materia prima para satisfacer la demanda de sus productos y, además podrá cumplir con todas las exigencias que requieren las autoridades de sanidad, así le podrá dar una mejor imagen a su establecimiento y estará en la capacidad de atraer nuevos clientes. María sueña con poder ampliar su negocio, fortalecerlo y hacerlo crecer para que sea uno de los más reconocidos en la zona y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
For the past twenty years María has worked in her own business, a small kiosk where she offers breakfast, lunch, fried foods, pastries, soft drinks, etc.  She's located next to a bus station so her main customers are local drivers.  She works alone every day from very early in the morning making the income she needs to pay expenses for the family, which includes her husband and three children whom she has gotten ahead with a great deal of effort

She's currently seeking the support of a loan, which she'll invest in the purchase of wholesale supplies (vegetables, meat, rice, chicken, soft drinks, pastries, etc.) and improvements to her stall (replacing the dishwasher).  This will allow her to have the main items at hand to satisfy demand for her products and to be able to comply with all the health officials' requirements.  She'll also be able to put a better face on her establishment and attract new customers.  María dreams of being able to expand her business, strengthen it, and grow it into one of the best-known in the area, guaranteeing the economic stability needed to provide her family better well-being.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (vegetables, meat, rice, chicken, soft drinks, etc) and to make improvements to her locale (replace the dishwasher).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married to Grace. Together they are blessed with a one-year-old child.

For the past five years Joseph has sold bread and cakes in Naivasha. He obtained a first loan to buy bakery goods to increase his stock. He successfully paid the loan off.

Joseph is now applying for a 60,000 KES loan through VisionFund Kenya to buy more bread and cakes to sell. He hopes to garner great profits from this loan. As for the future, he hopes to prosper in his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more bread and cakes to sell

loans.name: Rejia

texts.en:
Rejia is a married woman. She is a housewife of 37 years old. Her husband Tazmal is 45 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in the small village of Barosoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).  Rejia is blessed with four sons. All of them go to school. They read in class VIII (grade 8), class VII (grade 7), class VI (grade 6) and class II (grade 2).

Rejia's husband has a small business of selling betel nuts (used as mouth fresheners), which grow on their own land. His earning is not sufficient to cover the household activities and the educational expenses of their children.

Rejia wants to help her husband. She came to know about BJS and has decided to take a loan from them to start a new business of cultivating potatoes, which are in great demand in the present market. She will use the loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and manure to start cultivation of potatoes on their own piece of land. She hopes her business will ensure her family members a decent lifestyle; especially so her children will have a better education and a better future.

In the future, she wants to build a pacca house (concrete-made) with the profit she earns from her business.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is a member of Amuka Group in Chwele District. He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund  farmers. The group is made up of a total of 82 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. David has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving the necessary inputs to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
David is 34 years old and has been a farmer for 15 years. David works as a farmer to provide for his three children. The community and other farmers know David as friendly, hardworking and reliable. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the men's group and the savings group.  David described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

David is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. David joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get fertilizer, hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. David plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  

David and the Amuka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Jotham

texts.en:
Jotham is a 27-year-old from Nakuru. He is married to Mildred, and they are blessed with one four year old child.

He owns a motorcycle which he uses for public transportation. He has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly income of 5,800 KES.

Jotham has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use his loan to open another business selling charcoal.

He anticipates that he will use his profits to pay back his loan, educate his child, and expand his charcoal business. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land, to build houses for rent, and to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to open a charcoal selling business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is thirty years old, unmarried and from Nakuru. For the past ten years he has operated a small retail shop from which he makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

After taking out and repaying a first loan through VisionFund Kenya, Moses is now applying for a second loan of 50,000 KES. He plans to use the loan to buy more stock for his shop as well as pay off the loan itself.

As for the future, Moses hopes to buy a plot of land and build houses to rent.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for the support of the previous loan which helped her to buy food consumables for sale. 

She is again requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma  is a 33 year old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Currently, the taxi is not working properly so Uzma's husband is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair the taxi as soon as possible.

Due to the lack of money, it is difficult to cover the cost of repairing the taxi. Therefore, Uzma has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairs. This loan will help him to continue his business. 

Uzma is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the taxi engine.

loans.name: Mawunyo Group

texts.en:
Mary is in her late 40s, married, and has two children who are secondary school graduates. She runs a wax-print shop, which she has been doing for 13 years. She works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM every working day and is able to earn a very good monthly profit. 

Mary requested her seventh loan from ID-Ghana, which she will use to buy linen, batik, and wax-prints for the shop. With her previous loans, all of which were repaid, Mary used the funds to buy linen, batik, and wax-prints and to restock products for her shop. She dreams that one day will be able to build a house. 

Mary will share this loan amount of 9,300 GHS with her loan group, Mawunyo, which consists of six members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase linen, batik, and wax-prints f

loans.name: Santos Cristina

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica a la venta de pan de forma ambulante, además realiza trabajos en casas particulares como planchar y lavar, lo hace para tener ingresos que son utilizados para apoyar en los gastos familiares. Es casada y es madre de dos hijos.
El préstamo que está solicitando es para  invertirlo en la compra de una plancha para hacer pupusas, es una nueva actividad económica que piensa desempeñar por las tardes todos los días como una forma de tener ingresos extras para cancelar la deuda y seguir aportando en los gastos de su hogar.
Sueña con crecer en sus actividades económicas por lo que espera su venta de pupusas le de capital suficiente para instalar una tienda en su hogar.
texts.en:
Santos makes a living selling bread a street vendor and also works doing washing and ironing in private homes. She does this work in order to earn an income to help pay household expenses. Santos is married and a mother to two children.

Santos is applying for a loan to invest in an iron in order to make "pupusas" (a cheese and meat stuffed tortilla).  She is planning to work at this new job every afternoon so that she can earn a higher income to pay off her debts and to continue supporting household with the bills.

Santos dreams of expanding her businesses and she hopes that this new "pupusa" business will give her enough capital to open a shop in her home.

loans.use: to buy an iron.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is married and the mother of one child. They live in a two-bedroom house in Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in living, some of which include sickness, death, and inadequate capital to finance her business.

With this new loan requested, she will buy more of her business containers and more foodstuffs, and she will also renovate her business place. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because of an attractive location and her regular customers who buy from her. 

With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices.  She will help them maintain a healthier life thanks to her quality meals

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family's needs, ensure her child's education, and provide food for the family. She will also look for a bigger business place and add different kinds of food items to her line of business.

She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.  Also social needs of members are catered to at GHAPE

loans.use: To buy more beans, yams, oil, and drinks and  renovate her business site.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is married with two children. Both of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,a000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes.  She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house. The family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Juan Benito

texts.es: El señor Juan es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe en la comarca llamadas Enrramadas, casado padre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad, la actividad comercial de don Juan es  la compra y venta de Frutas y Verduras, negocio del cual ya tiene mas de 6 años, el credito lo esta solicitando para compra de unas cosechas de Papayas, Ayotes, Platanos, Guayabas. ya que el comercializa todo su producto en los departamento en ocasiones lleva a los diferentes mercados de la capital a comercializar frutas, agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic  le estan brindado. ya que con  las ganancias obtenidas mejorara las condiciones de vida de el y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the town of Ticuantepe in the region of Enrramadas. He is a married father of two children who are above the age of majority. 

Juan's main work is buying and selling fruit and vegetables, and he has been doing this for more than six years. He is requesting this loan in order to buy a large amount of papayas, pumpkins, bananas, and guavas. He sells his fruit and vegetables throughout the region, and, on occasion, sells in the different markets in the capital city. 

Juan thanks Kiva and Afodenic for their support, as with his future earnings, he will be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 37 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Lucy, and they are blessed with two children aged fifteen and ten years old. For the past six years he has farmed and raised livestock. From this work he earns 12,000 KES a month.

Mathew took out and successfully repaid two prior loans. He is now applying for a third loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to improve his farm by buying more fertilizer, etc.

Mathew anticipates using new profits from his farm to pay off the loan, educate his children and boost his farm’s productivity. He hopes to buy a plot of land and build houses to rent.

loans.use: To buy more farm inputs for his farming activity.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastian, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es soltera y tiene 39 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende chupetes, galletas, gaseosas y chocolates, ella tiene una carreta donde vende las golosinas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 2 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetes,galletas,gaseosas y chocolates.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de peluches, negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Virgen de Copacabana de San Sebastián", located in the San Sebastian district, province of Cusco (Department of Cusco). Juana is one of its members. She is 39 years old, is single and has 3 children. 

Juana has her own business selling sweets and sells lollipops, biscuits, fizzy drinks and chocolates. She has a cart to sell the sweets in the streets from 8am to 7pm. She has had this business for 2 years and things are going well for her.   Her dream is to have a grocery shop. 

Juana is requesting the loan to buy lollipops, biscuits, fizzy drinks and chocolates.

The other group members work in businesses selling cuddly toys, sweets, groceries or providing taxi services.  Juana is grateful to the people who make this dream possible and commits to paying her instalments as scheduled.

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo had his photo taken later, having asked permission for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, biscuits, fizzy drinks and chocolates.

loans.name: Mauna

texts.en:
Mauna appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Beside the charcoal selling business, Mauna practices poultry farming.

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more chicks for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 34 years old and single with no children for now. She runs a retail business in Magburaka, Northern area, in Sierra Leone.

She has been in this business since 1990 and sells pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits within her community. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that her business is doing well.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to take care of her parent and increase her business. 

In the future, she would like to open a big provision store in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with three children. In order to help support her spouse and meet the needs of her children, she started sewing at home. She did not have a hard time finding customers and soon opened a shop with a partner. However, she and her partner separated, and she opened her own shop. With a loan from Maya Fatma bought a sewing machine and for seven years ran the shop and did all of the sewing on her own.

In addition to her sewing Fatma sells Amway products. Because most of the Amway sales are order-based, cash is tight so she would like to get a loan. If she had the Amway products in bulk, she would be able to make more of a profit and be able to give her customers their goods when they come into the store instead of having to wait for delivery.

Fatma is now applying for a 1,000 TRY loan through Maya to buy more Amway stock and sewing materials. Two of her children are getting married, and the youngest would like to finish university. Once these obligations with the children are over, Fatma would like to go on a pilgrimage.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Fatma Hanım,evli ve 3 çocuğu var. İlk başlarda eşine destek olmak,çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için evde dikiş dikmeye başlamış. Evlenmeden önce de dikiş dikiyordu. Çevresi vardı ve müşteri bulmakta pek sıkıntı çekmedi. Sonra bir kişi ile ortak dükkan açtı.Fakat ortağı ile anlaşamayınca ayrıldı ve kendine dükkan açtı. Yedi senedir de tek başına dükkanında dikiş dikiyor. Dükkanını açtıktan bir süre sonra makine alması gerekiyordu ve elinde nakiti yoktu. Mayadan kredi aldı . Yedi senedir kendi dükkanında dikiyor.Fatma Hanım, dükkanında amwey ürünleri de satıyor. Dükkanına gelen müşterileri alıyor hatta bir çoğu alıştı ve sipariş veriyorlar. Şimdi de nakde sıkışık olduğundan ve malzeme alması gerektiğinden maya ya tekrar dan müracat etti ve aldığı kredi ile dükkanına terzi malzemeleri olan astar,tela,iplik,fermuar alacak.Bunun yanında kredinin bir kısmı ile de gene amwey den kozmetik ürünler alıp satacak. Elinde sermayesi olup toplu mal malzeme aldığında daha karı oluyor. Toplu alınca ucuza mal ediyor.Müşteri geldiğinde sıkışmadan elinde ki malzeme ile hemen dikiyor. Çocuklarının ikisini evlendirmiş. Küçük çocuğunu okutmak ,üniversiteyi bitirmesini istiyor. Onun sorumluluğu da üzerinden kalktığında Hac’a gitmek ve bu vazifesini yerine getirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more Amway stock and sewing materials.

loans.name: Armenak

texts.en:
Armenak is an experienced agronomist from the Eghegnut village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife and son. 

To take care of his family Armenak is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding livestock of pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of tomatoes, eggplant, alfalfa, and grapes. With the help of his son he realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. Armenak's wife assists him greatly in his daily activities related to farming. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Armenak needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 2,700 will be great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase a cow, buy some forage (combined forage and alfalfa), and pay for the workforce during the harvesting. 

Armenak and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness

loans.use: to purchase a cow, buy some forage, and  pay for the workforce during harvesting

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 28 years old. She is a dedicated young woman who has a vision of transforming her life. For this loan, she will use Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Sobita

texts.en:
Sobita is 27, a woman with much strength and many dreams for her and her family, and a mother to two sons. Sobita has an education up to class VIII (grade 8). She was not able to continue her studies due to the lack of financial resources of her parents. Her husband, Biswanath, aged 28 years, is illiterate and can only sign his name. One of the children receives education and reads in class II (grade 2). The second son is under school-going age. They have a kachha house (bamboo, mud and straw-made) in Alta village in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sobita's husband is engaged in agricultural work. The land he works is their own, inherited from his parents. There he grows different kinds of seasonal vegetables. He carries them to the local market and sells them. In this way, he earns and meets the family's needs. But his small income is not sufficient to maintain a family of four, when the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds.

So, they thought to start potato cultivation on their land. Sobita heard that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives loans to the rural women to start new businesses. So, she applied for a loan to purchase good-quality potato seeds and fertilizers to start a potato cultivation business. This product is in great demand in the present market. So, Sobita’s wish is to get a huge profit from the business.

Her goals are to expand her business to generate more profits, with which she will be able to help her husband with the family expenses, such as educational expenses of her children, health and food, and to invest the rest in her business.

Her future dream is to build a pacca house (concrete-made).

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Sahena

texts.en:
Sahena, 24 years old, is a housewife and a responsible mother, and living happily in the small village of Altagram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Because of their poor financial condition, they have been able to build a small kachha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw). Sahena attended school up to class V (grade 5), and her husband, Zakir, 26 years old, received education up to class VI (grade 6). One of their children is of school-going age and reads in class I (grade 1).

Sahena’s husband owns a plot of ancestral land where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. They sell them in the local market. Now they decided to cultivate potatoes on their land. She has taken a loan from BJS to buy potato seeds and fertilizers, and start potato cultivation, which is a very profitable business in that area.

She hopes the business will generate more profits, by which she will be able to meet the family's needs, give better education to her children and make some savings to build a pacca house (concrete-made) in the future.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Lawuo H.

texts.en:
Please meet 44-year-old Lawuo from Liberia. She lives in the community near the airport. She is married and has six children between 8 and 25 years old. Five live at home and attend school. For the past 25 years she been running a shop selling flour, sugar, oil, etc.

She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 8 hours each day at her business. She is appreciative of her business because she makes money. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, oil, etc. for her business. She would like to thank BRAC Liberia for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Celine is married and a mother of five children. They live in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including sickness. Her brother was strangled to death and her son was struck dead by lightning.

With this new loan requested she will buy fertilizer to increase her harvest and seeds of various types, including corn, beans, yams and groundnuts. She holds a positive view of this business because she has vast land for farming and also because of her regular customers she supplies her products to. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling prices, and maintain a healthier life thanks to the quality products she will supply.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs; ensure her children's education, provide food for the family and cater for her children medication. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Social needs of members are also catered to at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en:
Yehya is forty-six years old, married, and lives in Rafah City. He has two young daughters. 

For the past thirteen years, Yehya has owned a small grocery shop. It is a good business and the shop is located in a very good area of the city. Yehya would like to expand his store by selling more products.  However, he doesn't have enough money. Therefore, he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, the store will be in a better condition and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
She is married and the mother of six children. They live in a ten-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, the economic capital of the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has encountered so many challenges in life, some of which includes; sickness, injured legs, and inadequate capital to finance her business.

With this new loan, she will buy more of her egusi and firewood to expand her business .She holds a positive view of the business succeeding because she has been carrying out this business for a long time and knows her customers' taste. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices, and she will help them maintain a balance diet due to proteins from egusi (seeds from a melon-like plant).

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family needs, ensure her children's education and medication and also improve her standard of living. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed; also social needs of members are catered to at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy egusi and firewood.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 38 años, está casada con Dolores de 46 años y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive conjuntamente en una vivienda hecha a base de adobe en calidad de alquiler. Posee un taller de carpintería en la que viene trabajando hace más de 10 años siendo su principal fuente de ingreso. Se inicio en este oficio con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos puesto que anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, no obstante al tener conocimientos en el rubro maderero decidió invertir los pocos ahorros que tenía para adquirir sus equipos para la elaboración de diversos mobiliarios hechos a base de madera. Entre sus productos con mayor demanda esta la elaboración de muebles de uso común y casas prefabricadas que tiene buena demanda en la  zona donde reside.Suele obtener los bloques de madera que trabaja desde zonas reforestadas puesto que en su localidad la responsabilidad  ambiental por parte de las autoridades es muy competente. 
Para el desempeño de sus labores cuenta con ayudantes quienes son jóvenes y espera también así ser una alternativa laboral para su pueblo. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a kiva y se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable en su trabajo y familia. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de bloques de madera esperando cumplir sus trabajos encomendados.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 and married to Dolores, 46. They have three children who live with them in a rented adobe house.  He has a carpentry shop where he has worked for more than ten years and which is his main source of income.  He started out with the goal of increasing his income, having formerly worked in agriculture.  Even though he knew people in the lumber business, he decided to invest his small savings in equipment for making a variety of wooden furniture.  Among his most requested products are everyday furniture and prefab houses that are in high demand in the area where he lives.  He tends to get the boards he uses from reforested land, because the environmental responsibility authorities in his area are very competent.  

Juan has young people that help him out in his work; he hopes to be an alternative source of jobs for his town.  This is the first loan he's seeking from Kiva.  He's known to be a very responsible person, in both his work and his family.  He's requesting 2000 soles to buy wooden boards to finish filling orders.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 50 años, está casada con Graciela de 44 años y tiene 2 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Desde muy niño creció en el campo junto a sus padres quienes le inculcaron la labor agrícola y aprendió a usarlo como una principal fuente de ingreso para mantener económicamente a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con 6 hectáreas de parcela con plantaciones de cacao orgánico, café, piña; entre otros productos con amplia demanda en su localidad. Hace varios años destino parte de sus parcelas al sembrío de árboles madereros con el objetivo de obtener a futuro ingresos por la venta de madera de sus áreas reforestadas. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de piña y luego sembrarlas en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
