Rodrigo is 50 years old and the husband of Graciela, with whom he has two children. The family lives in a their own home, which is made of wood.

Rodrigo has worked on farms since he was very young, when his parents taught him to do agricultural labor. Rodrigo used this experience to make farming the main source of income with which he supports his family. Rodrigo now has a six-hectare plot where he grows organic cacao, coffee, pineapples, and other produce that is in high demand in his area. Several years ago, Rodrigo set aside part of his land to plant lumber trees so that he can sell the lumber in the future and earn income from his reforested land. 

This is Rodrigo's first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support he's receiving to grow his business. He is also committed to making his payments on time. Rodrigo would like 4,000 new soles to purchase pineapple plants for his land.

loans.use: to purchase pineapple plants.

loans.name: Los Amigos Empresarios Group

texts.es: “LOS AMIGOS EMPRESARIOS” está compuesta por socios (as) trabajadores y muy entusiastas quienes se sienten muy contentos por estar pasando el 04 ciclo. Shirley tiene 31 años es soltera con una hija de 08 años educando. Hace un año y medio se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios para damas. Años atrás trabajaba como azafata profesora de danza. Es de esta manera que puede educar a su pequeña hija. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de polo pantalones y shorts. Su mayor deseo es tener su propia marca de ropa y tiendas a nivel nacional. El grupo cumple la función de secretaria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Shirley es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: "Los Amigos Empresarios" is made up of hardworking, very enthusiastic members who feel very pleased to have entered their fourth loan cycle. Shirley is 31 and single with an eight-year-old daughter who is in school.  For the past year-and-a-half she has earned her living selling women's clothing and accessories.  In past years she was a flight attendant and a dance teacher.  This is how she's been able to educate her little daughter.  Shirley will invest her loan in the purchase of polo shirts, pants, and shorts.  Her greatest wish is to have her own nationwide clothing line and stores.  She's the secretary of the group.  The group appreciates Kiva lenders for the loans they provide.  Shirley is the pictured second from the left.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, pants, and shorts.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai is 40 years old and married with two children. He runs a local food stuff store in Waterloo, the eastern rural area of Freetown.

He has been in this business for 10 years and sells gari, palm oil, beans and pepper. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is poor road network.

Abdulai requested this loan through BRAC to buy more local food stuff like gari, palm oil, beans and pepper for resale. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to take care of his family's welfare and increase his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business more than ever.

loans.use: to buy more local food stuff like gari, palm oil, beans and pepper for resale.

loans.name: Jebbeh Tetee

texts.en: Thirty-five-year old Jebbeh Tetee lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has two children at the ages of 9 and 12 who are presently in school and live at home. She did not go to school, but she has good business skills. Her husband runs a provision shop. She has been involved in sales of rice by the bag since 2005 from a shop, and she started this business by selling fire coal, mineral water, shortbread and juice. She enjoys the flow of customers and the way her business makes her self-sufficient. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to expand her business. She hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Here is Esther from Liberia; more precisely, she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. Esther is 42 years of age. She did not attend school, and she is married with four children. Only the last born, who is 26, lives at home and attends school. Esther started her business with money from her oldest child, who is a farmer. She sells for 12 hours each day at her business, from Monday to Saturday; a problem she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, Maggi cubes, onions, peppers, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day move her business from a table to a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, Maggi cubes, onions, peppers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jose Gerardo

texts.es:
José, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia, es empleado como maestro desde hace ya 10 años, también se dedica a la pesca y la albañilería, son oficios que aprendió de su papá los cuales realiza en su tiempo libre, por su experiencia no tiene dificultad para organizarse en sus diferentes actividades económicas.
En esta oportunidad solicita capital para comprar láminas, cemento y arena, con los que realizara trabajos de mejoras a su vivienda, para poco a poco mejorar las condiciones de  la misma y dar a su familia un ambiente más seguro.
Sueña con reconstruir su vivienda, tener un buen equipo de pesca y  ayudar a su esposa a emprender un tipo de negocio para generar ingresos extras y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Jose is married, has two children, and has been working as a teacher for ten years.  He also fishes and works as a mason.  These are the things he learned and does in his spare time.  He doesn’t have any trouble doing his financial activities.

He is asking for a loan to buy metal sheeting, cement, and sand so he can make improvements to his home and be able to increase his quality of life little by little and provide his family a safer environment.

He dreams of rebuilding his house, having good fishing equipment, and helping his wife start a business to generate extra income and improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy buildning materials.

loans.name: Charles

texts.es:
Simón, tiene 24 años de edad, el vive en la cálida ciudad de Nazca, junto a su hija recién nacida su esposa. Simón trabaja en un Mini Market de la cuidad, trabajo el cual lo realiza como mucho empeño y responsabilidad, el siempre está pendiente de darle la mejor atención a los clientes que acuden al mini market y de esta manera ser el mejor colaborador de todos los meses.
Simón está muy agradecido con los prestatarios de Kiva, ya el dinero lo invertirá en poner el piso a su domicilio y de esta manera darle una buena calidad de vida a su linda familia.
El sueño de Simón, es construir su casa propia vivir muy feliz junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Simón is 24 and lives in the warm city of Nazca with his wife and their baby daughter. He works in a Mini Market in the city, a job that he does with great energy and responsibility. Simón is always read to provide the best service to the customers who come into the Mini Market and thus be the best employee all year round. 

Simón is very grateful to Kiva lenders as he will use these loan funds to install a floor in his home and thus provide a good quality of life to his lovely family. His dream is to build his own home and live happily with his family.

loans.use: to install a floor in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of his thesis.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jenny, necesita capital para comprar pintura para dar una mejor imagen de su negocio, con el resto comprara maíz, arroz, azúcar, jabón entre otros productos para surtir su tienda, espera tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas, tener más ingresos extras con lo que podrá cancelar la deuda y tener un negocio mucho más fuerte.
Con el crédito anterior el inventario de su tienda se fortaleció comprando productos de primera necesidad que solicitaban sus clientes, sus ventas aumentaron, y su economía ha mejorado.
texts.en: Jenny needs capital to buy paint so she can improve the appearance of her business.  She will use the rest to buy corn, rice, sugar, soap, and other products to stock her store.  She hopes to get more customers, increase her sales, have more extra income with which she will be able to pay off the loan, and have a much stronger business.  With the previous loan she fortified her store's inventory by buying consumer goods that her customers asked for.  Her sales increased and her financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, sugar, soap, and other products

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael is a member of the Amukeni Group in the Kakamega North District. She is pictured here in a group of 8 One Acre Fund farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 95 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Rael has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Rael is married and has 5 children. She is 46 years old and is known as being friendly and trustworthy. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. Rael has been a farmer for 20 years. Rael described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Rael first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Rael joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices get new farming methods. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member. She also wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Rael plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Rael’s own life was improved because she has more farm training and was able to feed the family.

Rael and the Amukeni Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat lives in the Aygabats village of Shirak region with his big family of 7: his wife, two sons, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren ages 10 and 7 years old. Azat is an enthusiastic farmer with many years of experience working in that field. He keeps livestock of cows, sheep, pigs and chickens as well as cultivates wheat and grass.

Azat sells the gathered milk and meat in the local open market and gathers income for his big family. Unfortunately because of the family's poor conditions, Azat hardly manages to cover the daily expenses and there is no money left for investing in the farm and enlarging it. That's the reason Azat has applied for this loan. It will enable him to purchase seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is the first loan for Azat, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

Azat hopes for lenders' support as the loan will greatly assist him to gather more income and provide better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Fleria's Group

texts.en:
Litookho is a group of five farmers in the Kakamega North District, with Fleria selected as the Kiva representative.  

Fleria has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 56 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Fleria is 50 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years.  She works as a farmer to provide for her seven children.  The community and other farmers know Fleria as trustworthy.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community such as the women's group and prayer group.  

Fleria described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Fleria joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and she is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Fleria joined One Acre Fund so that she could get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed family.  Because she wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Fleria has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  

Working with One Acre Fund has improved Fleria's life because she has more profits from herharvest and was able to feed her family.  In the future, Fleria hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school.  				

Fleria and the Litookho Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  

With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo, on the left.

loans.use: To buy cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Alex's Group

texts.en:
Alex is a member of Korokoro M SHG Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund farmers.  

The group leaders represent a total of 87 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Alex has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.
							
Alex is married and has one child.  He is 28 years old and is known as friendly, hard-working, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and prayer group.  

Alex has been a farmer for six years.  He described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Alex first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Alex joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, fertilizers, and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Alex plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Alex’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, was able to save money, and feed his family.  
							
Alex and the Korokoro M SHG Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  

With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, una joven emprendedora de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato en la ciudad, se graduó hace ya 12 años.  Actualmente, es madre soltera de una niña de un año de edad. Vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos, la familia es muy unida y desde pequeños se han crecido trabajando en la agricultura y otras actividades. Ella trabaja para darle el sostenimiento a su pequeña niña y a sus padres.

Actualmente, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, el cual lo hace en un carro de su familia y lo hace acompañada de su hermano; quien es el que maneja el vehículo. Lleva de trabajar más de un año en la venta de verduras y frutas, su madre le enseño el negocio y fue así como ella aprendió y desde entonces está laborando, casi todos los días desde muy temprano para ir a vender a las comunidades aledañas. 

También hace pan y puede tejer hamacas de seda, el cual es un negocio que lo aprendió de su madre y le generan ingresos económicos. A las 4 de la mañana salen muy temprano a comprar verduras y frutas a la ciudad, llegan a las 5 de la mañana y desde ahí, comienzan a vender por las comunidades hasta la tarde que regresan a la vivienda. Mientras ella con su hermano venden, su madre le cuida la niña.

El financiamiento que solicita, lo necesita para invertir $400.00 en verduras (pepinos, tomates, repollo, remolacha, zanahoria, chiles, cebolla, ajo, brocoli, lechuga, y otros) además comprara frutas (sandias, piña, guineos, naranjas y otros) y también invertirá $315.00 en la compra de hilo de seda para la elaboración de las hamacas de seda, (70 libras) y otros gastos para la familia.

Con ello pretende incrementar sus productos y a la vez vender las hamacas en las comunidades donde comercializa.

Sueña construir en el futuro su propia vivienda digna, para dejarle de herencia a su hija y darle el estudio hasta que sea una profesional, también pretende de las ganancias poco a poco ir ahorrando para comprar un carro en un mejor estado, para tener más seguridad cuando salen a vender.
texts.en:
Gloria is a young 32 years old entrepreneur.  She earned a bachelor’s degree 12 years ago and is currently the single mother of a one year old daughter.  She lives with her parents and two siblings.  The family is very united and grew up farming and doing other things since they were very young.  She works to support her young daughter and parents.

She and her brother currently sell fruits and vegetables with the family car.  He drives the car and they have been doing this for more than a year.  It was her mother who taught them this business and how she learned to work this way.  Nearly every day she goes out to sell in the nearby neighborhoods.

She also bakes bread and makes silk hammocks, which she also learned from her mother and it generates additional income.  She and her brother go out at 4:00 am to buy fruits and vegetables in the city.  They arrive at 5:00 am and begin selling in the surrounding communities until returning home.  Her mother cares for her daughter while she and her brother are selling.

She will use $400 of this loan to buy vegetables (cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbage, beets, carrots, peppers, onions, garlic, broccoli, lettuce, and other things).  She will also buy fruits (watermelons, pineapples, bananas, oranges, and other things), and spend $315 on silk chord (70 lbs) to make hammocks, and pay some other family expenses. 

This will allow her to increase her number of products and sell hammocks in the communities where she makes her other sales.

She dreams of a future with a dignified home of her own so she can provide an inheritance and an education to her daughter so she can become a professional.  She also wants to save up to buy a car in better shape so that she can be safer when she goes out to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a young, enthusiastic and energetic woman, 30 years old, and the mother of one son and one daughter. She is a housewife. She lives accompanied by her life partner. She attended school up to class VI (grade 6), whereas her husband, Mahesh, aged 41 years, is illiterate and can only sign his name. Both their son and daughter are receiving education. They are in class VI (grade 6), and class IV (grade 4) respectively. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made) in the small village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Jayanti’s husband is a rickshaw puller. The rickshaw which he pulls is not his own; it is rented. Her husband’s income is too low to run a family of four members, as life is getting more expensive over time. 

Jayanti learned about BJS and applied for a loan to help her husband to buy a cycle-rickshaw for carrying people from one place to another. They hope that their earnings will be more from this, as they will not have to pay any rent.

Her future dreams are to offer their children a better education and to enjoy a better quality of life. Her full thanks go to both BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-rickshaw for carrying people from one place to another.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 41-year-old resident from the remote region of Bagnan in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a housewife and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). She is married to Dilip who is 45 years old and runs a small stationery shop. Both Jayanti and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. They are providing education to their children with much difficulty.  The boy attends college, and the girl is attending class X (Grade 10).  They have a small kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made).

Jayanti's husband's earnings are the main source of income for the family, but are hardly enough to cover food and household costs for the family. Jayanti has a strong will to surpass the financial hurdles of her family.  So she asked for a loan from BJS to help her husband.  She decided to cultivate bananas in their small piece of land. She will purchase banana saplings and fertilizers to start cultivation of banana trees in their own piece of land. As bananas are a very common fruit and have a great demand in their locality, she hopes to earn profit from this new business.

Her goal is to increase and improve the production, which would help her dream of improving the living conditions of her children, providing them with education, and buying another piece of land to keep on cultivating.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase banana saplings and fertilizers for cultivation of banana trees.

loans.name: Rowayda

texts.en:
Rowayda is an eighteen year old married lady from Jabalia. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Therefore, her husband appears in the photo that was taken in their store.

Rowayda lives with her husband in a small and humble house. For the past two years, Rowayda's husband has owned a small grocery store. It is a good business and his shop is located in a very good area of the city. Rowayda and her husband would like to expand their store by selling more products, but they do not have enough money. 

Therefore, Rowayda is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more products to sell in their grocery shop. With this loan, the store will be in a better condition and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Sandra Noemy

texts.es:
Sandra, es madre de una joven de 18 años de edad, es la única persona que de ella, se dedica a la costura, tiene empleados que le ayudan a cumplir con sus pedidos, ya tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio lo que le evita tener algún problema.
Invertirá en la compra de tela y reparación de su máquina de coser, le facilitara tener materia prima por mayor para seguir elaborando las diferentes pizas de costuras encargadas por sus clientes, también su equipo estará en condiciones opimas para que no se retrasen los pedidos, espera tener una mejor atención hacia sus clientes, mejorar su economía y cancelar sus cuotas.
Sueña con mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, mejorar las condiciones familiares, y seguir dando empleo a las personas que le colaboran.
texts.en:
Sandra is the mother of an 18 year old girl.  She is a seamstress and has employees who help satisfy her customer orders and has lots of business experience which prevents her from having problems.

She will buy fabric and repair her sewing machine.  She is glad to have supplies in quantity so she can continue to make different things that her customers order from her.  Her equipment will also be in optimum shape so that she will not fall behind in her orders.  She hopes to be able to be more attentive to her customers, improve her finances, and pay off her debts.

She dreams of improving her business’ infrastructure, family conditions, and continuing to provide jobs.

loans.use: to buy supplies and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Lizzette Del Carmen

texts.es: Lizzette del Carmen, mayor de edad madre soltera de dos hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, donde predomina, el comercio, ademas donde esta uno de las ingenios mas importante del país, es propietaria de de un kiosco donde ofrece venta de comida rápida como sándwich, HotDog, pizza, productos variados de golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, refrescos naturales, ubicado en uno de los parques de esta localidad el cual es muy bien concurrido por la gente, inicia este negocio con capital propio de unos ahorros proveniente de mi anterior trabajo, se le dio la oportunidad de hacerse cargo de este lugar y así inicia, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su negocio, incrementar su inventario, para comprar productos que actualmente no oferta, al tener más productos en  existencia  puede ofertar variedad de comida rápida y así el cliente tiene más opción de escoger por lo tanto sus ganancias van a incrementar, uno de sus sueños es poder construir su propia casa por que actualmente solo tiene el terreno, ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales
texts.en: Lizzette del Carmen is the single mother of two children who still dependent on her.  She is from the town of Chinandega, where there are many merchants and where she has a kiosk from where she sells fast food such as sandwiches, hot dogs, pizza, various snack foods, soft drinks, juices, and natural drinks.  It is located in one of the most well-known parks.  She started this business with her own savings from her previous work and got the opportunity to take charge of this location.  She will use the money from this loan to invest into her business and increase her inventory by buying the products that she currently offers.  This will allow her to offer a greater variety of fast food, allowing her customers to have a greater selection to choose from, as well as increasing her income.  One of her dreams is to build a house of her own because at the moment she only has land.  She also wants to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsa, tiene 48 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Chiclayo, Elsa tiene 2 hijos un en edad escolar.
Elsa se dedica a la venta de comida (desayunos, almuerzos y cenas), gracias a la buena sazón de Elsa, ella atiende aproximadamente a 40 clientes diarios. Elsa siempre está pendiente de darles la mejor atención a sus clientes y de esta manera día a día aumente su clientela.
Elsa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios de Kiva, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en comprar utensilios de cocina(ollas, cubiertos, etc.) y de esta manera mejorar el servicios que le brinda a sus clientes.
El sueño de Elsa, es hacer más grande su negocio de comida y formar su propio restaurante, ofreciendo los más ricos potajes de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
texts.en:
Elsa is 48, the mother of two school-aged children, and lives with her family in the lovely city of Chiclayo. 

Elsa has a business selling food (breakfast, lunch, and dinner), and her tasty seasoning has helped her build a base of approximately 40 daily diners. Elsa is always ready to provide these customers the best service and thus attract even more people to her business. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders as she'll use these loan funds to purchase cooking utensils (pots, cutlery, and other tools) and thus provide better service to her customers. 

Elsa's dream is to expand her food business and open her own restaurant, serving the most delicious dishes in Chiclayo.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furnishings for her home

loans.name: Lourdes Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que día a día, trabaja en su negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios ya que actualmente estudia enfermería

Pamela gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá solventar los gastos para la compra de materiales para sus estudios como libros y también para pagar la mensualidad, de esta manera ella podrá seguir asistiendo a sus clases y poder tener las herramientas necesarias para seguir estudiando y realizar su sueño de ser una gran profesional y poder tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Pamela is a young woman with a great will to advance. It is for that reason that she works day after day in her business, where she sells cell phones and accessories. From her business, she has income to pay for her school expenses, since she is now studying nursing.

Pamela, thanks to the support of the Kiva lenders, will be able to pay her expenses to buy materials for her studies, such as books, and also pay the monthly fees. In this way she will be able to continue attending her classes and have the necessary tools to continue studying and make a reality of her dream of being a good professional and having her own home.

loans.use: to buy school materials and make monthly payments.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, tiene una familia unida compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares se dedica a vender junto a su madre pupusas y antojitos (tostadas, yuca y enchiladas) en la unidad de salud de su localidad, la venta de pupusas lo hace de 6:30 a.m. a 11:00 p.m., mientras que la venta de antojitos lo realiza de 1:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
Con el Crédito comprar plátano, yuca, maíz, tomates, repollo y aceite, para seguir trabajando y produciendo más productos, espera atraer más clientes, mejorar la calidad de los productos y obtener mejores ganancias, con las que podrá cancelar sus deudas y darle a su familia un apoyo incondicional.
Su sueño es fundar una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sandra is part of a loving family consisting of her husband and their three children. To help her husband with family expenses, Sandra and her mother sell stuffed tortillas and snacks (toast, yucca, and enchiladas) at the local health unit. The tortillas are sold from 6 am to 11 pm, while the snacks are sold between 1 am and 5 pm.

With the money from the loan Sandra will buy bananas, yucca, tomatoes, cabbage and oil so she can continue working and making more products. She hopes to attract more customers, improve the quality of her products, and earn more money. With this income she will be able to pay off her debts and provide her family with more support.

Sandra’s dream is to open a store selling basic necessities in her house.

loans.use: buy bananas, yucca, tomatoes, cabbage and oil

loans.name: Jose Aurelio

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito para adquirir más herramientas y seguir desempeñando su trabajo como albañil, comprara 2 palas, 3 piochas, 2 barras, entre otras piezas que necesita dar un buen servicio.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a continuar adquiriendo lo necesario para que su negocio crezca, ya que tiene más clientes y sus economía ha mejorado de una manera que le permitió cancelar las cuotas y brindar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan in order to acquire more tools and to keep doing his job as a bricklayer. He will buy 2 shovels, 3 picks, and 2 bars, among other tools that he needs in order to provide a good service.

He used his previous loan to purchase what he needed to make his business grow, which got him more customers, improving his economy in a way that allowed him to pay his loan and provide his family better food, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy 2 shovels, 3 picks and 2 bars

loans.name: Fulada

texts.en:
Fulada, who is 26 years old, is married with three children. She is from the remote area of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Her husband Amal is a daily labourer.  She lives with her children (three daughters) and husband in their own pacca house (concrete made). All the three daughters are receiving education.
 
Fulada's husband's income is not enough to meet their household expenses and their children's educational expenses. So Fulada has decided to start tea cultivation in their plot of land.  The idea came to her as an alternative way to generate more income. She applied for a loan from BJS to buy tea seedlings and fertilizers to start cultivation of tea plants, and start a business of selling tea leaves in their locality.  Tea leaves are in good demand in the present market.

With perseverance, love and great dedication Fulada hopes she will be able to achieve her objectives and earn enough money to help her husband with the family's finances. Fulada's dream is to continue earning money with this business. In this way she will be able to continue to support her children. She would like to offer them the opportunity to go to higher studies, so that they have a more prosperous and successful future.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy tea seedlings and fertilizers to start cultivation of tea plants.

loans.name: Kunjabala

texts.en:
Kunjabala is 41 years old and a housewife who is married to Sokin. They are raising two children and live in a remote town, Bagnan, in the district Jalpaiguri. Both husband and wife are illiterate and can only sign their names. With great difficulty they are paying the educational costs of their son and daughter who are in class VIII (Grade 8) and class IV (Grade 4).  They have a pacca house( concrete-made).

Kunjabala's husband, 45 years old, grows different vegetables in different seasons. The harvests are sold at the local market.  Due to the increase in prices of essential goods, it is very difficult to meet the household and educational expenses of their children. 

Kunjabala decided to start a milk supply business. Kunjabala has applied for the loan to purchase a dairy cow.  Her plan is to sell milk from door-to-door in her locality, which has a great demand in the present market.  In this way she will generate sufficient income to support the household.

Kunjabala wants to continue tirelessly working and continuing to advance in her business and hopes to be able to achieve her great dream to buy more cows for better profit and offer her family a better quality of life.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Suniti

texts.en:
Suniti is a hardworking woman who is only 25 years old.  She is married, and she has completed education up to 7th standard (Grade 7). It was because of her family's poor economic status that she could not continue studying.

Suniti is married to Ramen, 32 years old, and she is the mother two children (one son, one daughter).  They live in the small village of Domohoni in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own small kachha house( mud, bamboo and straw-made). Suniti's husband studied up to class V Grade 5). Their son is in class II (Grade 2). Their daughter is below school-going age.

Suniti's husband is a farmer. The land that he cultivates was given to him by his parents.  There he grows seasonal vegetables and sells them in the local market. Suniti also assists him in his agricultural activities, besides doing the household work.   

Suniti has taken a loan from BJS to grow potatoes in their land.  She wants to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have an excellent harvest, and earn a good profit as the produce has a good demand in the present market.

Suniti will also be able to reach her goals of giving better education to her children and covering the family's financial needs with the profit generated from the business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Rebecca, who lives  in the Airport area of Margibi County, Liberia. Married to an electrician, she and her husband have four children between the ages of 6 and 20, all of whom are in school and live at home. Rebecca completed the 9th grade before she decided to go into business. 

Over the past 10 years, Rebecca, a hardworking woman, has been selling rice, pepper, flour, drinks, and artificial hair in the local market for eight hours daily from Monday to Saturday. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, flour, drinks and artificial hair for her business. Her plans are to build her house and help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, flour, drinks and artificial hair for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Please to meet Comfort, who is 41 years old and from Liberia.  To be precise, she lives in the community surrounding Airport.  She is unmarried with four children between 3 and 22 years old, who live at home and attend school. 

For the past five years she been selling red oil in the local market. She started her business with money from her mother and learned this way of selling from her.  She sells from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. from Monday to Saturday.  She is grateful of her business because she gets money every day.

Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her bread business. She would like to thanks BRAC Liberia for their continous support.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her bread business.

loans.name: Jose Dimas

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, es casado, vive junto a su esposa, sus hijos ya son independientes, este negocio lo aprendió de su papá, lo realiza en un horario de 8:00 a.m. has ñas 5:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en realizarla.
Con el préstamo comprara una vaquilla y vitaminas para tenerla saludable, la engordara posteriormente la venderá, espera fortalecer su negocio y tener mejores ganancias, con las cuales cancelara sus cuotas y mejorara su estilo de vida junto a su esposa.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable y mejorar la economía familiar.
texts.en:
José makes a living from raising and selling cattle. He lives together with his wife since their children are now independent. He learned this trade from his father, which he does from 8:00 am till 5:00 pm, and haven't had any problems with it so far.

With this loan, José will buy a heifer and the vitamins to keep her healthy. He will fatten it and later sell it. He expects to strengthen his business and to have greater profits, with which he will pay the loan and improve his lifestyle. He dreams of having a more profitable business and improving his family economy.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and vitamins

loans.name: Bertha Alis

texts.es:
Bertha, está acondicionando su negocio para esta temporada de fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, invertirá en la compra de variedad de frutas y verduras, permitiéndole ofrecer producto fresco y de calidad a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior fortaleció su negocio, dándole la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos, aumento el número de clientes, cancelo sus cuotas de forma puntual y las circunstancias familiares han cambiado.
texts.en:
Bertha is preparing her business for the Christmas and New Year celebrations. She will buy various fruit and vegetables which will allow her to offer fresh, quality produce to her customers.

With her previous loan, Bertha improved her business so she earned more money, increased her customer base, and paid off the loan installments punctually. Her family situation has also changed for the better.

loans.use: buy various fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jumah

texts.en:
34-year-old Jumah from Liberia is married and her husband is a contractor. They have 3 children aged between 3 and 17 and all three of them live at home and currently attend school. She lives in the Caldwell, this area is becoming to be one of the most populated communities in Montserrado due to the good roads, quietness, and lower costs of rent. 

For over ten years now, she has been selling coal by bag in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending nine hours each day on her business. 

Her main challenges is the rainy season, but she realizes some profit at this time. She started this business with money from her husband, and learned about business from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal by bag for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal by bag for her business.

loans.name: Menyee

texts.en:
Menyee is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with three children; they are in school and live at home. 

For two years now, Menyee has been selling oil, rice, sugar, etc. from a table. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profits and income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, sugar, etc. for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Janna

texts.en:
Janna is 27 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has three children.  Only two of them attend school; they all live with her.  

For two years Janna has had a table in the local market where she sells rice. Sometimes she has many customers and makes good money and sometimes it's very slow. She started selling for her mother, and later decided to sell on her own. 

Janna is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. She wants to improve and continue growing her business. 

She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Mammie

texts.en: Mammie lives in Buchanan with her three children between 5 and 18 years old. She is 37 years old, married and has been running a local beauty salon for the past ten years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned how to fix and dress hair from her mother. She is asking for a loan to buy more artificial hair for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 43 years old. She lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Annie did not go to school. She is married, and she has 7 children between 11 and 28 years old. With a little money from her older husband, who is a farmer, she was able to start a business selling used clothes. She spends 9 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 45 years old. She lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Ruth stopped going to school in the 6th grade. She is married, and has 8 children between the ages of 5 and 28. Only 4 of her children are in school. Ruth managed to start her business with a little money from her mother 10 years ago. She spends 9 hours each day working at her business, from Monday to Saturday. She faces no problems except her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day to own a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca mayor de edad madre soltera, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona ubicada en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora con deseos de superación personal, responsable en sus pagos, es propietaria de un molino donde ofrece sus servicio a comerciantes de su comunidad para moler distintos productos de granos como: maíz, trigo, sorgo, semillas, cacao entre otros, también se dedica a la venta de maíz en quintales, al igual que ingresos de otros negocios que ella tiene los cuales ha logrado establecer por su buena administración, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de maíz, y darle mantenimiento a sus molinos para así prestar un mejor servicios a sus clientes, su jornada diaria es desde muy temprano 4:00am  y finaliza después de las 7:00pm así sus clientes quedan satisfecho por el trato que ella les brinda, Juana agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is an older single woman.  She's from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, an area located in the western part of the country.  She's known for being an enterprising woman with a desire for self-improvement and for being responsible with her payments.  She owns a mill where she offers her services to the community grinding various grain products like corn, wheat, sorghum, seeds, cacao, etc.  She also sells corn by the quintal and brings in income from other businesses that she succeeded in starting with her good management. 

Juana intends to use this loan to buy corn and maintain her mills so she can provide better service to her clients.  Her work day starts very early, 4AM, and runs til after 7PM.  Her clients are very satisfied with how she treats them.  Juana really appreciates the support Kiva lenders provide to low-income people.

loans.use: to buy corn and for upkeep on her mills.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix tiene 51 años, está casado con Herlinda y vive en su casa hecha a base de adobe únicamente con su esposa puesto que sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes. Se dedica a la producción de café en la comunidad de Santa Fé donde posee un terreno de 2 hectáreas que le cedieron sus padres y que también adquirió gracias a las ganancias percibidas. Tiene más de 35 años de experiencia en el rubro y desde que se inició ha logrado solventar sus gastos familiares gracias a la venta de los granos de café orgánico.
Realiza sus actividades cotidianas gracias con el firme de apoyo de su esposa y de trabajadores que contrata cuando su carga laboral es complicada. Le agrada mucho permanecer en sus terrenos de cultivo ya que está acostumbrado a la labor agrícola que lo caracteriza. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000.00 nuevos soles para invertirlos en sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Felix is 51 and married to Herlinda.  He lives in an adobe house with only his wife because their children are grown up and independent.  He earns his living in coffee production in the community of Santa Fé where he has 2 hectares of land he got from his parents and with prior earnings.  He has more than 35 years of experience and since starting out he has managed to pay for family expenses by selling organic coffee beans.  He does his daily work with steady help from his wife, and from hired workers when the work gets tough.  He really appreciates staying in his fields because he's used to the farm work.  

This is the second loan Felix is seeking from Kiva.  He appreciates the financial support he receives to get ahead.  He promises to make his payments on time.  He is currently requesting a loan for 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of organic fertilizer for his fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos Eliseo

texts.es:
Santos, forma parte de una familia que está integrada por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad, para sustentar a su familia se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, la actividad de cultivar granos básicos la ejerce de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 p.m., el resto del tiempo lo dedica  al cuido de los cerdos.
Solicita capital para pagar mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha y comprar cerdos, fortalecerá el negocio tendrá a tiempo los granos en su hogar  y podrá aumentar las ganancias por las ventas de los cerdos, mejorar su economía familiar y lograr salir de sus deudas.
Sueña con estabilizarse económicamente para brindar a sus hijos estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Santos is a member of a family composed of his life partner and two kids, aged 7 and 8. In order to provide sustenance for his family, he grows basic staples and raises pigs, the former from 6:00 a.m. till 12:00 p.m. and the latter afterwards.

He is requesting capital in order to harvest his crop and to buy pigs. He will strengthen his business, have the grains at his home on time and will be able to increase the profits from the pigs he sells, improving his family economy and paying his debts. He dreams of economically stabilising in order to provide higher education to his children.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.es:
María, necesita capital para pagar la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y maicillo, también comprara un cerdo para engordarlo y luego venderlo, de esta manera su negocio crece cada vez más.
Con el crédito anterior fortaleció el negocio dándole la oportunidad de continuar trabajando, mejorar los ingresos familiares. Su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María needs a loan to pay for her corn and sorghum crop to be harvested. As well she wishes to buy a pig to fatten and then sell. In this way her business will gradually grow.

With her previous loan she expanded her business so she could continue working and earning more money to support her family. Her family now has a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy a pig and harvest her corn and sorghum crop

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Ibrahim from Magburaka, Makeni, in the northern area of Sierra Leone.  For the past ten years, he has been running an electronics business within a busy market area where he sells cables, lights, fans, plugs, radio bulbs and switches. Ibrahim works from seven in the morning through six at night six days each week. His main business challenge is his poor purchasing power. Ibrahim did not going to school and he started his business to provide for his family.   

Ibrahim is requesting a loan to purchase different kinds of electronics such as cables, lights, fans, plugs, radio bulbs and switches. He will use the extra income from his loan to open a savings account and take care of his family’s welfare. In the future, Ibrahim plans to expand his business more than even. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase electronics such as cables, lights, fans, plugs, radio bulbs and switches

loans.name: Nohn

texts.en:
Nohn lives in the Ganta area; she is 40 years old, and has 4 children between the ages of 7 and 16.  They are in school and live at home. 

She stopped her education in the third grade.  She is married, and her husband is a local businessman. 

For the past ten years, she has been running a shop where she sells oil by the gallon, soap, and other items. She started this business with money that she received from her husband.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, soap, and others items to attract more customers. 

Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, soap, and other items to attract more customers.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, 24, lives in the Ganta area and has three children between the ages of 8 months and 8 years.  One is in school and lives at home. 

She stopped her education at fourth grade. She is married and her husband is with a company. 

For the past three years, she has been running a shop where she sells iron soap (local soap made with caustic and palm oil). She started this business with money from her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business. 

Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Susuanna P.

texts.en:
Susuanna P. is 42 years old and lives in Seclapea City in Nimba County. She did not go to school. She is married and has three children between  6 and 9 years old; they are in school and live at home.  Her husband is a local businessman. For the past three years, she has been selling oil. She sells 12 hours each day in a week. She described herself as a serious woman. 

Susuanna P.  started this business from her husband's earnings, and learned this trade from her friends. Her business has enabled her to support her family which makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. Her plans are to educate all her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
47 year old Mary lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Mary did not go to school. She is married, and she has 10 children between 11 and 29 years old. She got a little money from her husband, who is a lawyer, to establish her business. She describes herself as a hard-working business woman. She spends 12 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to sell. Her plan is to one day to build a store.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Lirije

texts.en:
Lirije wants to buy a dairy cow and she is requesting an amount of 250,000 Albanian Lek to achieve this; this will be her first loan.
Lirije and her family live in the southeastern part of the country in a village where poverty is evident; a majority of them fall below the poverty level. 

Lirije’s son has been going to Greece for seasonal work for the past years in an attempt to increase the family’s income. In addition, her family has been running a little livestock type of activity for the past almost ten years and has been selling the raw milk to the locals in the surrounding areas.

Lirije would like to deliver appreciation to the lenders in advance and wish them the best for this year :)

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en: Irshad is a 58 year old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past several days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the repair costs. Therefore Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Irshad is so thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 45-year-old married woman who has five children. She is living in a populated area and her husband knows about the requirements of people in this area. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal vegetables from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has 15 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he can receive the maximum reward for his efforts. Shazia applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more vegetables and thus increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mamuda

texts.en:
Mamuda is 40 years old .She is married to Aijul who is 50 years old. Both of them are illiterate but can sign their names. They have four children; two of them are in class viii (grade 8) and iii (grade 3). The other children are engaged in farming. 

She lives in the village of Madhya Boragari in Dhupguri with her husband. They have their own plot of land where they usually grow potatoes and sell them to the local market. She decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to help her husband in buying seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes. Her idea is that a financial support can give a good future to her children. Her future plan is to make her business run smoothly.

She lives in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw) but she wants to contribute something to her family.  She plans to upgrade her house to a pacca house (concrete house) with the profit she earns from her business.

She is thankful to BJS for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and good quality fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Wekesa's Group

texts.en:
Wekesa is a member of the Best Home Group in Matete District.  He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of fifty-three individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Wekesa has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Wekesa is married and has ten children.  He is 60-years-old and is known as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Wekesa has been a farmer for twenty years.  He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  						
Wekesa first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Wekesa joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, and he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Wekesa plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home and save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Wekesa’s own life was improved because he has more profits from the harvest, able to save money and feed the family. 
 							
Wekesa and the Best Home Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 50-year-old Lebanese woman. She is divorced and living independently. Hala pays her everyday expenses with the income that she earns from her business which is a mini market. Her store is nearby her house and she sells products to customers from her community and neighboring towns as well. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a large quantity of food provisions since she wants to increase her sales and thus her income. Hala feels weak since she struggles by herself to meet the life requirements.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of food provisions.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. Khalil cooperates with his father and brother to be able to pay the high costs of living. He has been the owner of a bakery since 2011. He produces delicious pastries and fresh ones where people come purposely to enjoy their taste. And presently, he is in urgent need to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new oven as soon as he can since his oven is damaged at the moment. He has to do something promptly to resolve this issue to keep on producing his appetizing goods. He states that he will also be renewing his baking tools. Khalil is a gentleman and his only concern is to persist in satisfying his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven and renew his baking tools.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Meet Mamie, she is a 48-year-old from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. She has two additional dependents at home. In 2003, Mamie established a food stand business within a busy market area. She began this business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her children; she works at the business from 10:00 am until 12:00 pm, six days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit, she is able to take care of her family.

Mamie requires a loan in order to purchase more onions, flour, cooking oil and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Mamie plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, flour, cooking oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata, she is in her early forties from the Waterloo eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children.  For the past eleven years, Aminata has established a retail business within the Waterloo community. She began this business because she wants to contribute in taking care of the children; she works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to this business is price inflation of goods and storage facilities.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more building material such as an iron rod and cement and a carton of biscuits. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Aminata plans to build her own shop and become a distributor of building material. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more building material such as an iron rod and cement and a carton of biscuits.

loans.name: Mabel Jaritza

texts.es: Mabel habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, Acompañada y madre un hijo en edad escolar, se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 3 años, su compañero la apoya economica con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja por cuanta propia como Albañil. el crediro lo solicita para incrementar su mercaderia ella vende. Perfumes para damas y caballeros, tratamientos para la piel, Sombras, Rubor, pinturas labiales, etc. su clientad ya le han realizado varios encargos ya que Mabel vende muy favorable sus productos, Agradece el apoyo que se le esta brindado con este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mabel is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. She has a partner and is the mother of a school-age son. She has worked in a commercial activity for three years. Her partner provides economic support for the household expenses, since he is a self-employed mason. She is applying for the loan to increase the merchandise she sells, such as perfumes for women and men, skin treatments, eye shadow, blush, lipstick, etc. Her customers have given her a number of orders, since Mabel sells her products at very favorable prices. She is grateful for the assistance that is being offered to her with this financing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en: Tracy is married with five children, all whom go to school. She doesn’t have an additional family member. She sells used clothes on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 3 years. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease the transportation of goods and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes bills, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Sylvia Mabe

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five children. They all live in a two-bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced many challenges in life, among which are sickness, the death of her mother and her daughter, accidents and financial difficulties.

With this new loan requested, she will buy food items such as rice, beans, oil, salt, Maggi (flavor cubes), and other goods to increase her business. She believes that this business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time and in addition to her regular customers, her business is located in a good, attractive area that acts as a form of advertisement. In addition foodstuffs are always in high demand. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling prices, provide food for the rapidly increasing population, and maintain a healthier living standard.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family needs, ensure her children's education, provide food for the family, and will also expand her business. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Also, the social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, corn, palm wine and beer

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 46-year-old widowed Lebanese woman living with her two children. In order to provide her children with enough income, she decided in 1995 to start working, producing a wide variety of homemade food which she sells to customers from her town and neighboring villages. Her goods are prepared along with seasons. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase electrical equipment such as a food-mixer to proceed with preparing food faster and easier and therefore meet her customers' orders on time.  In the future, she plans to open a proper shop and start selling her own goods.

loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment such as a food-mixer

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man. He is a construction worker, and has been working in this type of business for the past ten years. He specializes in placing pavers over floors and against walls. He is talented at his profession. Today, Hussein is very excited to apply for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase new tools and particularly a cutting machine to be able to continue to work easily. Hussein is doing his best to be able to earn a greater income as he wants to continue building his own house where he will get married and raise his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and particularly a cutting machine

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He has owned a mobile shop in which he sells mobiles as well as rechargeable cards. Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase cellular phones and prepaid rechargeable cards. The largest part of mobile users purchase these cards.  That’s the reason why Khodor seeks to acquire these purchases so as to be able to increase his sales by a large percentage.  This is his first Kiva loan and he is very optimistic about what he will attain monetarily after getting it. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase its capital.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phones and prepaid rechargeable cards

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, who attend school. Her husband owns a mini-tractor on which he performs construction tasks.  She collaborates with him to gather an adequate amount of money to live in good conditions. As for Faten’s work, she has been a tailor since 2005, specializing in repairing women's clothes. She also sells scarves. This family’s financial situation is not very encouraging and this is why Faten seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.   She plans to purchase a new tailoring machine and items needed such as textiles, needles, etc. to increase her productivity and, therefore, her income and be able to enhance the family’s way of living.

loans.use: purchase a new tailoring machine and items needed such as textiles, needles, etc.

loans.name: Protus' Group

texts.en:
Protus’ group has 3 leader farmers and is located in Chwele District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 32 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Protus is pictured on the right of the Lutaso Group with his hand raised.
							
Protus is 39 years old and has been a farmer for 24 years. Protus works as a farmer to provide for his 6 children. The community and other farmers know Protus as hardworking. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community's activities, such as the men's group and savings group. Protus described his harvest last year as excellent, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of the One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
Protus first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Protus joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Protus plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Protus’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and has more farm group support.  
							
Protus and the Lutaso Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with two children and one child goes to school. She takes care of  one additional family member (mother). 

Rehema operates a boutique selling secondhand dresses on a retail basis at the market. She also takes care of additional family members. She has been in this business for three years and works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand dresses. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She is aspiring to get permanent business premises and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes paying utility bills, rent, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Blanca Gilma

texts.es:
Blanca, es casada, tiene cinco hijos,  lo cuales viven junto a ella, para proporcionar apoyo en los gastos familiares se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y ganados, está actividad la realiza desde su juventud, por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ganado, lo que le ayudara fortalecer el negocio, lo que ayudara tener más ganado que ofrecer a sus compradores y por ende sus ganancias serán mayores, las cuales utilizara para cumplir con los compromisos de pagar sus cuotas.
Se mayor aspiración es brindar a sus hijos muchas oportunidades en la superación académica, así como también mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Blanca is married, with 5 children who live with her. In order to handle the household expenses she works raising pigs, chickens, and cattle. She has been engaged in this activity since her youth, so she has a lot of experience in her business.

She will invest the loan to buy cattle which will strengthen the business and with more livestock to offer her buyers she will have higher profits, which she will use to pay her monthly loan payments.

Her greatest aspiration is to offer her children many educational opportunities towards their success as well as better nutrition, health and clothing.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en:
Majlinda, who has been in the agriculture industry for the past ten years, is now requesting a loan to buy potato and onion seeds for planting. 

Majlinda is married and has three young children. They live in a southeastern region that is known nationally for producing the best potatoes and onions, and large quantities as well. The soil in their region supports these kinds of plants and locals consider themselves “lucky."  

“Some of us do just this, plant and sell and we make a good income. We expected to generate more income from this though, yet, the government hasn’t make arrangements for us to export our products and sometimes they go rotten in our fields and our efforts go to the drainage unfortunately. Let’s see what the new government will do, as they have promised to help,” said Majlinda.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds for planting

loans.name: Lovetee

texts.en: Lovetee lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and the living condition is much better than the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populate county in Liberia. Lovetee is 23 years old. She stopped attending school in the 6th grade and is unmarried with two children aged one month and 4 years old. With a little money from her motherLovetee was able to open a shop where she sells gasoline and motorcycle parts. She spends 9 hours each day on her business from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more gasoline by the gallon and motorcycle parts for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a gasoline station.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline by the gallon and motorcycle parts for her business.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en: Azra lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a welder by profession. He is the only earning source of income for the family.
