texts.en: Rose is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells food at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 4 years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of oranges, pineapples, tomatoes, cabbages, Irish potatoes, and passion fruit. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She is aspiring of becoming wholesaler and also getting a permanent residence.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of pineapples, oranges, cabbage, Irish potatoes and passion fruit.

loans.name: Daniel Alfonso

texts.es: A sus 56 años Daniel trabaja muy duro para mantener a su familia y  mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Daniel es albañil y agricultor, estos oficios le permiten llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y dar a sus  hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Actualmente, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y colaboran con los gastos del hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ya que el techo de su vivienda se ha deteriorado y desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Espera poder contar con este crédito que solicita a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para dar inicio a la reparación del techo que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
At 56, Daniel works very hard to support his family and improve their living conditions.  

Daniel is a construction worker and farmer.  These positions allow him to provide for his family daily and give his children better living conditions.  Currently, his sons are now adults and work with him on the living expenses.  He wants to improve their housing conditions since the roof of their house has deteriorated, and he wants to prove greater safety for his family.

He hopes he can rely on this loan he's requesting from FUSAI to use for purchasing galvanized corrugated metal sheets and wood to start repairing the roof they so badly need.

loans.use: to buy galvanized corrugated metal sheets and wood for repairing the roof.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a highly spirited  entrepreneur who does farming and produces fruit trees like mango in Misamis Occidental. He in fact has been many years in this business and was so successful that he was able to support his family and successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that he used to add capital. 

Recently, he has just borrowed an amount from GDMPC micro-finance for additional capital and to buy fertilizers and organic pesticides. He hopes that in time, his business will expand.

loans.use: for additional capital and to buy fertilizers and organic pesticides

loans.name: Felis

texts.en: Felis appreciates her previous Kiva loan which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Tony Angel

texts.es:
Tony, está casado, tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia, no posee ayuda del extranjero, para generar los ingresos con los que cubre los gastos familiares se dedica a cultivar maíz, es un oficio que aprendió en su familia, su mayor ventaja es que lo hace en tierras propias.
Solicita el capital para invertirlo en la en el pago de mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de esta temporada, de esta forma tendrá en menor tiempo el maíz en su casa para luego venderlo con mucha anticipación y tener mejores anticipación.
Sueña con hacer mejoras a su vivienda y ofrecer un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Tony is married, has 1 son, and lives with his family. He receives no aid from abroad. To generate the income needed to cover family expenses, he cultivates corn. This is a skill that he learned from his parents. Tony's major advantage is that he owns the fields that he cultivates.

Tony is requesting funds to invest in his farm by hiring labor for this season's harvest. In this manner, he will shortly have his corn in his house, and he is anxious to sell it and reap the benefits.

Tony's dream is to improve his home and offer his family a more secure roof.

loans.use: to invest in hiring agricultural laborers for this season's harvest.

loans.name: Carminda

texts.en:
Carminda is applying for a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is married, she has four children, and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy items such as long sleeved and short sleeved shirts, trousers, and shorts.

Carminda opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $600.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions. She is happy with the loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy long sleeve and short sleeve shirts, trousers, and shorts

loans.name: Bishara

texts.en: Bishara appreciates her previous Kiva loan which improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Alie from Waterloo, western rural area in Freetown. He is married with 2 children. For the past 10 years, Alie established his plastic slippers business. He began his business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to support his parents. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that is very hardworking and desires to educate his children.

Alie requires a loan in order to purchase more cartons of plastic slippers to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and renovate his business structure. In the future; Alie plans to become more successful and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchases cartons of plastic slippers to expand his business

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Foday from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 2 children.  For the past 7 years, Foday established a building materials business. He began his business because he lost his parent at anearly age. So he decided to go in to business to empower himself. He works at the business 13 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business lack of enough capital to operate it..

Foday requires a loan in order to buy zinc, cement,and Iron rod and head pan to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and pay his children's school fees.  In the future; Foday plans to open a big building material shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy zinc, cement,and Iron rod and head pan to expand his business

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda, a 42-year-old, hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and two daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is a carpenter. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Rasheeda is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She is a tailor, and wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will expand her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Rasheeda requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for her family's future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000, Amina wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1971 года. Зулайхо замужем и на воспитании имеет  4 детей. Она работает более 22 года в средней школе учителем. Она имеет высшее образование. Зулайхо получает маленькую зарплату. Ее муж строитель и он тоже не имеет большого дохода, чтобы обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Зулайхо должна провести свадебное торжество своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulaykho is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1971, is married, and is raising four children. She has worked for over 22 years as a high school teacher, and she has a college education. Zulaykho earns just a small salary. Her husband is a construction worker and also doesn't earn a lot to provide for the family with. Zulaykho needs to throw the wedding celebration for her son, but doesn't have the money. She is asking for a 3000 somoni loan for the wedding festivities. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: pay for her son's wedding celebration

loans.name: Sandra Esmeralda

texts.es: Sandra de 39 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita junto a sus hijos de 20 años, 15 años y una hija de 4 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es que sus hijos se encuentren bien y puedan tener acceso a mejores oportunidades a las que ella ha tenido. Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias de forma ambulante. Este negocio le permite llevar el sustento  a su hogar y mantener la economía de su familia. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y sencillas y desea mejorar el área de cocina ya que las paredes y techo no están completas y se encuentran en mal estado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y lámina galvanizada y comenzar la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Sandra, 39, is a single mother and lives with her sons who are 20 and 15, and a daughter who is 4.   For her, the most important thing is that her children be well off and that they be able to have access to better conditions that she has had.

Sandra works as a mobile vendor selling clothing and sandals.  This business allows her to sustain her home and prove for the finances of her family.  Their housing conditions are very humble and simple and she wishes to improve the kitchen area since the walls and roof are not complete and are in bad shape.

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to use for buying brick, cement, sand, iron and galvanized metal sheets and start to improve it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and galvanized metal sheets to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Gladis Elena

texts.es: Gladis de 51 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 20 años y 17 años de edad. Habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y sus hijos. Gladis es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce, demás, también se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante. Con el fin de dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia desea hacer algunas mejoras en su casa como: encementar el piso y hacer una canaleta para la salida del agua lluvia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder dar inicio a las reparaciones lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Gladis, 51, is a single mother of two children, ages 20 and 17.  She lives in her own house with her family and her children.

Gladis is a very hardworking and responsible woman.  She earns a living making and selling pan dulce [sweet bread] and providing housekeeping services.  The most important thing to her is her family, which is why she works hard to get them ahead.

To give her family better living conditions she wants to make some improvements in her house: cement the floor and make a gutter for the rain.  This is why she's asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in buying sand, cement, and gravel.  She hopes to be able to have this support so she can start the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en: Gorretti is married with two children and both her children go to school. She has additional family members (sisters). She sells timber at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 3 years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more pieces of timber. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale and also to build her own house.  She currently resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more pices of timber.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Musa from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 1 child.  For the past 4 years, Musa established his clothing business. He began his business because his father died eary, so he raised money to start up his business. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business lack of enough capital.

Musa requires a loan in order to buy slippers, shoes and ladies jeans to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan.  In the future; Musa plans to renovate his business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes and ladies jeans to expand his business.

loans.name: Gbrilla

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Gbrilla from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12 years.  In 1991, Gbrilla established his clothing business. He began his business because after completing his sixth form, his family could not afford to pay his collage fees, so he  raised money to start up his business. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Gbrilla requires a loan in order to buy mens trousers and shirts to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan.  In the future, Gbrilla plans to renovate his business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mens trousers and shirts to expand his business.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Meet Alie, He is 48-year-old from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 8 children.  For the past 30 years, Alie established his local food business. He began his business because his parents did not send him to school, so he was trained to do business. He works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are storage facilities and high cost of transportation.

Alie requires a loan in order to purchase more beans, gari and bags of ground for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to empower himself and increase his business. In the future, Alie plans to build a big house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, gari and bags of ground for resale.

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
This is 43 year old Yayah from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 2 children, between the ages of 7 and 10 years. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to support his family.  

Yayah runs a general store. He sells drinks, cigarettes, pure water and tooth paste. He has been running this business 1 year. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that he is very hardworking and hopes to educate his children.  His major hardship is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Yayah has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarette, pure water and tooth paste. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installment and have his daily meal. In the future, He plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarette, pure water and tooth paste.

loans.name: Sheka

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Sheka from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 1 child.  For the past 5 years, Sheka established his building material business. He began his business because he could not further his education after secondary school. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that his business is doing well, because out of profit, it enables him to take care of his family welfare.

Sheka requires a loan in order to buy zinc, cement, and Iron rod and head pan to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and pay his children school fees. In the future; Sheka plans to renovate his business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy zinc, cement, Iron rod and head pan to expand his business.

loans.name: Catholic Center Group

texts.en:
These four members are part of a Nuru International group of farmers called Catholic Center, and is based within the Kuria West District. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Thomas, who is raising his hand, is 32 years old and has been a member of this group for more than two years now. He is married with four children who go to school.

Thomas is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to implement better farming methods that would lead to increased yields. If he gets a good yield of sorghum, millet and maize during the harvest of the 2014 long rains season, Thomas will be able to provide enough food for his family and sell the surplus. The money he gets from the surplus will be spent in investing in a business that would increase income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now and this is the source of their income.

Jeramie is asking for a loan to be used as an additional payment in buying a new boat engine. With this, her husband can go fishing and improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Jeramie hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to be used as an additional payment in buying a new boat engine.

loans.name: Giosahi A Group

texts.en:
Giosahi A is a Nuru International group of four farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm supplies. As a group, the members of Giosahi A collectively guarantee the loan.

James (on the far right with a black jacket and a cap) is a representative of the group. He is 49 years old and married with six children who go to school. He has been a member of this group since 2012. The loan for KIVA in this coming season will enable him to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizers which he believes will increase his farm yields. James, just like other members of his group, will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in a half acre, and sorghum and millet in a quarter acre each. He will obtain enough food for his household, as well as sell the surplus and pay school fees for some of his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia busies herself with selling health products and food supplements. She is able to support her husband with their daily needs and the education of their two children. 

Delia is into dealership of health products and food supplements and wants to expand her business to purchase more inventory to sell. She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for the funding needs and applied for a loan of PHP 50,000. She is happy to earn an income of PHP 10,000 per month. She hopes to open an store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories to sell

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelina is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Adelina has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Adelina requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc., for her business.

Adelina has been in this business for six years. Adelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc., for her business

loans.name: Yanina Yanela

texts.es:
Yanina tiene 34 años de edad  civil soltera tiene una hija, vive en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Yanina se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y arroz.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos y para dar mantenimiento especifico a sus siembras.
Vende sus productos en Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar su vivienda. El desafío que se enfrenta  el mal tiempo. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia.
texts.en:
Yanina, 34, is single and has a daughter.  She lives in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

Yanina is a member of the communal bank "Bruniquilde."  The members of this group live in Recinto Calabi in Ventanas canton, and they work in agriculture.

Yanina cultivates corn and rice.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to do some specific maintenance work on her crops.

Yanina sells her products in Ventanas.  Her dream is to improve her house.  She faces the challenge of bad weather.  In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to grow her crops

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a secondhand business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy clothes like shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, and short sleeves for kids and adults. She opened her secondhand business a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy clothes like shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, and short sleeves for children and adults.

loans.name: Teresina

texts.en:
Teresina applying for a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is married and  this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, milk, sugar, coffee, salt, soap, water, and slippers.

Teresina opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, milk, sugar, coffee, salt, soap, water, and slippers

loans.name: Marta Margarita

texts.es: Marta de 22 años de edad  es madre soltera de dos niños y una niña y habita junto a ellos en casa propia. Ella trabaja como empleada en una fábrica cercana a su localidad  y además, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia. De esta forma lleva el pan de cada día a sus hijos y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava para dar inicio a la reparación del piso lo antes posible.
texts.en: Marta is 22 years old.  She is a single mother of two boys and a girl.  She lives with them in a home she owns. She works as an employee in a factory near where she lives, and with hard work she has also been able to set up a small shop in her home. In this way she feeds her children and pays her bills.  She would like to repair the floor of her home so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, cement and gravel in order to start the repair work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and gravel to repair the floor of her home.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is from the village of San Antonio, Alicia. She is 40 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still attending school.  Catherine wants to uplift them out of poverty, which is the reason why she works hard to improve her variety store.  She runs this business for almost four years and is able to earn a minimum of PHP 300 a day.  At this moment, she is in need of an additional PHP 10,000.  This allows her to buy grocery items to sell within her local community, such as canned goods, noodles, beverage, condiments and curls. Catherine hopes that through her requested loan amount she could further improve her financial stability and let her children finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverage, condiments and curls.

loans.name: Akiba

texts.en:
Akiba is married with one child who is underage. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Akiba has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Riangoro B Group

texts.en:
This group of three farmers is called Riangoro B. It is a group of Nuru International farmers and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Cornel, raising up his hand, is 42 years old. He is married and was blessed with five children, all of whom go to school. He fully depends on subsistence agriculture. He has been a member of this group for two years now and is the group’s chairperson.

Cornel is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer. This is one way of implementing better farming methods that he has learned through his group. He believes this would lead to increased yields. When he gets good yields of sorghum, millet and maize during the harvest of 2014 long rains, he will be able to provide enough food for his family and sell the surplus. The money he gets from the surplus will be spent in investing in a business that would increase income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Las Sonrrientes Group

texts.es:
Las Sonrientes es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 mujeres emprendedoras y alegres, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Tres Valles donde la principal actividad económica es el cultivo de caña de azúcar y de piña, Anastacia es uno de los integrantes del grupo, ella platica que desde hace 18 años tiene en su hogar una tienda de abarrotes, ella dice que cuando inicio con su negocio vendía desde su casa y poco a poco construyo el local en el cual esta instalado actualmente su negocio, ella dice que siempre le gusta tener bien surtido su negocio para estar en la preferencia de sus clientes y tener buenas ventas, su tienda de abarrotes es la más grande y mejor surtida de su colonia y comenta que lo que más le gusta del negocio es que la ha ayudado a brindar una mejor vida a su familia y ha conocido muchas personas 
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará surtirse de insumos (detergentes, jabón de baño,pan, papel higenico, arroz, frijol, refrescos, productos enlatados, leche, aceite, dulces, jugos) paras continuar con sus ventas, 
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continúe progresando y cada día mejore sus venta y ganancias. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son: 
Guadalupe venta de ropa de cama
Corey venta de antojitos mexicanos
María de la luz entra de abarrotes 
Andrea venta de antojitos 
Neli venta de tortillas 
Brigida taller mecánico 
Marli purificadora de agua
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Sonrientes” and is made up of eight enterprising and happy women.  This group is located in Tres Valles where the raising of sugar cane and pineapples is the main economic activity.  Anastacia is one of the group’s members and she says that she has had a grocery store in her home for 18 years.  She started the business by selling out of her home and slowly built the store.  She likes keeping it well stocked so that her customers will prefer to buy from her and she will have good sales.  Her grocery store is the largest and best stocked in the neighborhood and she says that this business has helped her create a better life for her family and that she has met many people.

A Kiva and VisionFund loan will help her buy merchandise (detergent, bath soap, bread, bathroom tissue, rice, beans, soft drinks, canned goods, milk, cooking oil, candy, juices) so she can continue her sales.

She expects this investment to help her business continue and improve her sales and earnings daily.

The other members are:
Guadalupe sells bed clothing
Corey sells Mexican food
María de la luz sells groceries
Andrea sells food
Neli sells tortillas
Brigida has a mechanic shop
Marli purifies water

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 46 años de edad, está casada, tiene 7 hijos: 4 están casados y 3 viven con ella; ella vive junto a su familia en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella con mucho entusiasmo explica que se dedica a la preparación y venta de refacciones a domicilio. Para este oficio ella se apoya en una de sus hijas. Ella se dedica a esta labor porque a través de la misma obtiene los recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos familiares. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y con ella a logrado darles educación a sus hijos.
Además de esta actividad en su tiempo libre, ella también se dedica a los oficios domésticos con  una vecina de su comunidad, y los ingresos de esta actividad complementan su presupuesto familiar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de una estufa industrial.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las  condiciones de su vivienda y asi darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Estela is 46 years old.  She is married and has 7 children, 4 of whom are married and 3 of whom live with her.  She lives with her family in the Department of Sololá.  She enthusiastically tells us that she prepares and sells snacks door to door.  One of her daughters helps her with this work.  With this job she is able to earn money to cover the family's expenses.  She has done this work for 20 years, and it has enabled her to educate her children.  In her free time she also does domestic work with one of her neighbors.  This income supplements the family's budget.  She is requesting a loan for Q 3,000.00 to purchase an industrial stove.  Her greatest dream is to improve the conditions of her home in order to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial stove.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de LAFIABOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments de légumes et de la restauration à l’image de AWA qui est la deuxième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à LAFIABOUGOU dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités.  Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. AWA qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à LAFIABOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter avoir avec ce prêt 20  kilogrammes de condiments, 3 sacs de céréales divers et de tubercules pour servir pendant longtemps sans pénurie.  Elle s’approvisionne à KANGARE sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The DJIGUIYA group is part of the DANAYA association of Lafiabougou.  It comprises four women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties and are, on average, 25 years old.  Married with two children each, they are involved in various activities such as buying and selling condiments and vegetables.  Awa, a member of the group, prepares meals in her own restaurant.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right.  These women live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou, in the prefecture of Yanfolila (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They have been involved in small retail business for several years and their services are in high demand.

Eager to meet their customers' increasing needs, they decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso three years ago and this is their fifth solidarity loan.

Awa, who is also the group's representative, is quite well-known in Lafiabougou and she does an excellent job in her restaurant.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 kilos of condiments and three bags of various cereals and tubers, so that she can prepare meals for a long time, without suffering from any shortage.

She buys her goods from local wholesalers in Kangare and also resells in Kangare, on a retail basis.  She sells to both men and women and is paid in cash or on credit.

Awa is hoping to make a monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will help her to repay her loan and to further invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a hog grower and a vegetable vendor in her village. She is 45 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy rice bran for hogs and vegetables to sell. She hopes to keep improving her business to support her family’s daily needs and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy rice bran for hogs and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.  Agustina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Agustina has been in this business for two years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Baby Jasmin

texts.en:
Baby Jasmin is 34 years old and is married with three children. With two children currently in school, Baby Jasmin works very hard to provide for them.

Baby Jasmin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Baby Jasmin has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, laundry soap, biscuits, candies, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Baby Jasmin would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ervina

texts.en: Ervina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 42 years old. She is married and she has five children She is running a mini shop in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy items such as clothes for pregnant women, dresses, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, short sleeves and clothes for both kids and adults. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. She lives in a town near a school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 52 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom who are still in school.

Elena is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene una edad de 37 años es casada y madre de 4 hijos, ama de casa y agricultora ya que desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de piña siendo sus padres sus tutores en este rubro ya que en su familia es una vocación. Ella tiene 6 años de educación estudiantil por lo que esta muy agradecida con Dios por el apoyo brindado por sus padres tanto moral como económico. Sus hijos son adolescentes y de sus 4 hijos 3 viven con ella siendo ellos apoyo en las diferentes actividades practicadas en el campo como la limpieza, aplicación de abono, fungicidas entre otros. Sus clientes son los diferentes viajantes que se desplazan por la CA-5 de norte a sur y de este a oeste siendo esta calle la principal en el país.  
Ella tiene muchos sueños para con su familia y sus cultivos siendo uno de ellos la prosperidad de sus hijos apoyando a cada uno de ellos en sus estudios, metas y con un patrimonio que ayude al ingreso de sus hogares o a poder construir sus viviendas. Para con sus cultivos seguir incrementando la producción que conlleve al mejoramiento continuo y al desarrollo de su familia y hogar mediante la siembra de otros productos como yuca y café. También ella quisiera en un futuro poder arreglar su casa de habitación la cual necesita mejoras. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos de piña y obtener una excelente producción para esta temporada.
texts.en: Lucia is 37 years old.  She is married and mother to 4 children.  She is a housewife and has worked in agriculture for 20 years growing pineapples.  Her parents taught her this work as it is her family's trade.  She attended school through the 6th grade, and thanks God for the support her parents provided, both morally and financially.    Her children are adolescents.  Three of the 4 live with her and help her with the different activities in the fields such as weeding, fertilizing, and applying fungicides, etc.  Her customers are travelers who take the CA-5 from north to south and east to west, as this is the main road in the country.  She has many dreams for her family and for her crops.  For her family, she hopes for prosperity for her children and the ability to support each one of them with their education and goals.  She hopes to provide resources that increase their household income or allow them to build houses.  For her crops, she would like to expand to yucca and coffee.  In the future she would also like to fix up her house, which needs repairs. Today she is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies to care for her pineapple crop in order to have an excellent production this season.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to care for her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат молодая и умная женщина. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Саёхат более 5 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Теперь она хочет организовать новый бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она хочет открыть свой швейный цех. Саёхат участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 850 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sayohat is an intelligent young woman who is single and lives with her parents.  Although she has been involved in agriculture for more than five years, she now wants to start her own business.  She would like to open her own sewing shop and sew women's clothes.  She received a certificate after completing a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Association of Business Women.  She is taking a loan of 850 somoni to buy a sewing machine.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and start her new business.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en: Sokny is 39 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been employed at a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband sells fish. He makes an income of $7 daily. One of her children is also a garment worker who makes an income of $4 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sokny is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Merry Mhae

texts.en: Merry Mhae is a single entrepreneur who manages a service-based business providing transportation and rickshaw rental. Merry Mhae has been engaged in her business for more than three years and she earns well enough that she was able to support her parents and saved money from additional capital of the business. She also successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used in her business. Merry Mhae is requesting a new loan to buy an additional tricycle as a business improvement. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional tricycle.

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, opta por otro crédito debido a la facilidad de pago que se le brinda en la institución, esté nuevo crédito lo utilizara para invertirlo en pagar la mano de obra que necesita para recolectar la cosecha de maicillo y maíz.
El capital anterior le sirvió para generar una cosecha abundante y libre de plagas, su economía es más estable con la que ha cancelado sus cuotas, mejorado su estilo de vida familiar y ha comprado dos reces para fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en: Jose has decided to apply for another loan because of the easy payment terms given by the institution. He will use this new loan to pay for the labor necessary to harvest corn and sorghum. The previous funds were used to collect an abundant, pest-free harvest which stabilized his finances and allowed him to pay what he owed. This has improved his family life and he has bought two heads of cattle to strengthen his business.

loans.use: To pay for labor

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 35 years old and married with three children. With all three children currently in school, Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, bath soap, canned goods, noodles, etc. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more general store items to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 54-year-old married woman with eight children, three of whom are still in school.

Anecita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Anecita has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling silver jewelry in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Arlene is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more silver jewelry to sell.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Beverly requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread, fabric, zippers, etc. for her business. 

Beverly has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread, fabric, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 42 years old and is married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, cereals, seasonings, sanitary napkins, etc. 

Chona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long, 29, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including one son and his wife. Long and his wife earn money through their business selling Vietnamese music and musical equipment. He started this business nine years ago. He would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of Vietnamese music and musical equipment to meet his customers' needs. He hopes his business will ensure that his family members, and especially his child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy Vietnamese music and musical equipment to sell from his store.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor pedro actualmente tiene cosechada 2 manzanas de piñas las cuales requieren de cuido y mantenimiento, su esposa e hijos le dan todo el apoyo en cuanto al trabajo de la tierra, el creito lo solicita para la compra de Greenvita, Urea, Carburo, y Bomba Fumigadora para darle asi el cuido que se le debe de dar a los platillos de Piña quienes ya estan proximos a florecer. el mayor sueño de don Pedro es incrementar sus cultivos`por eso con las ganancias obtenidas compra nuevos hijos de piña para poder sembrar mas.
texts.en: Pedro at present has two fields of pineapples that need care and maintenance. His wife and sons give him all their support as to working in the fields. He has requested the loan to purchase plant nutrient, urea, calcium carbide, and insecticide sprayer to give the care the pineapple plants need as they are close to flowering. Pedro's biggest dream is to expand his planting and with the profits he makes he will buy pineapple crowns to plant more crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Berlenia Joliveth

texts.es: Berlenia, es una joven de 24 años de edad, que habita en casa de su madre junto a sus hermanas, en un barrio capitalino, es soltera  sin hijos se desempeña como docente en un colegio público, con sus ingresos apoya a su madre en los gastos del hogar. Actualmente tiene la prioridad de levantar el muro perimetral de la parte frontal de la vivienda para garantizar la seguridad de su familia, ya que la zona es vulnerable a la delincuencia, con el  financiamiento podrá comprar los materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques y piedrines.
texts.en: Berlenia is a 24-year old young woman.  She and her sisters live in their mother's house in a neighborhood near the capital.  She is single and has no children.  Berlenia works as a teacher in a public school.  With her income, she is able to help her mother with the household expenses.  Berlenia's current priority is to build a wall around the front perimeter of their house, to guarantee her family's safety.  The area where they live is susceptible to crime.  With the loan, Berlenia will be able to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, blocks and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, blocks and gravel.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is married and she has six children. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk in her house, selling water, fanta, coca-cola, coffee, sugar, salt, thread and buckets. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $600. She is making a good income from her business and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. She lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She is happy with the loan because TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offered the loan to her to improve her living conditions. Her husband is a farmer and she also has goats, pigs, a buffalo, and a cow.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is taking a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy foods such as onions, garlic, eggs, and vegetables. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, eggs, and vegetables.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 55 years old and widowed with two children.

Concepcion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Concepcion has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from dried fish vending.

Concepcion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 31 years old and married with one child. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, sugar, soy sauce, canned goods, diapers, etc. to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for seven years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, soy sauce, canned goods, diapers, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, sugar, soy sauce, canned goods, diapers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is married and has three children, two are in school and one is underage.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina is a farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four grown-up children.
Lodivina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus, augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Lodivina hopes of making her farming business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn is 53 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in a small village of Baray, Kampong Thom, where they work in the agricultural business growing rice. Korn has been working in this occupation for almost 30 years and earns a normal income of 5 USD per day, which she uses for meals and other costs of commodities. Farming is the sole source of the family’s income.

As of now, Korn is taking out a loan to add to her existing capital in order to make home improvements because her house, which has been built for years, has deteriorated and needs to be fixed instantly. She and her family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to add to her existing capital in order to make home improvements

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is 39-years-old and married.  The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. Lily is engaged in a street food selling business. She usually offers grilled liver, hot-dog(sausage), gizzards and barbecue within her local community.  She has been running her business for twelve years. With her determination to get ahead in life,  she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 which will be used to buy liver, hot-dogs(sausage), gizzards and eggs to sell.  She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the standard way of living for her family and be able to increase the income she generates from her food production sales business.

loans.use: to buy liver, hot-dogs(sausage), gizzards, eggs and barbecue.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, mucha alegría y muchos deseos de salir adelante con 36 años de edad ella ve y confía mucho en lo que a diario realiza en compañía de su compañero de hogar ya que desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra por medio de sus padres especializándose en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol. Ella es madre de 2 hijos los cual ambos estudian en la secundaria en diferentes grados. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario incompleto el cual pudo cursar hasta el 5 grado gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres a quien ella agradece la enseñanza y disciplina inculcada desde muy joven. Sus clientes son las bodegas, pulperías e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para comprar y re vender en otras zonas.
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a COMIXMUL el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran al mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que se prepara para sembrar la postrera. 
Los planes a futuro seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y convertirlos en profesionales con mejores oportunidades en la vida y con mejores fuentes de empleo.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman with many strengths, much joy, and a strong desire to get ahead. At 36 years old, she sees and trusts in the work that she and her partner realize daily. When she was very young, Martha learned to work the land from her parents. She specializes in growing staples such as corn and beans. Martha is the mother of two children, both of which are studying in different grades of high school. Martha did not complete elementary school. She was able to finish fifth grade with the financial and moral support of her parents, who she thanks for the knowledge and discipline they taught her from a young age. 

Martha's customers are the shop owners, food stands, and intermediaries who come to this region in order to buy products to sell in other regions. Martha has requested a loan from COMIXMUL, which she will invest in the purchase of farming supplies that will help her maintain her crops now that she is preparing for the second sowing season. Martha's plan for the future are to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they become professionals with better opportunities in life and better job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to assist the next crop that will be sown.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby has been helping her husband  manage their own farm for more than seven years now and this has become their main source of income. She and her husband have to persevere  in order to provide a good education for their three children. 

She earns so well from their farm that she was able to repay her previous loan successfully.  At the moment, she borrows an amount from GDMPC micro-finance to purchase fertilizer. She hopes to improve the farm someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twelve years, and she earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her handicraft business. Edita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Josefa Daisy

texts.es:
JOSEFA tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el conyugue en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

JOSEFA  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, polvillo morocho para los pollos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los sembríos. 

Los desafíos como la falta de riegos para los cultivos

Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en la ciudad de ventanas.

Los que mas pide es que en el futuro tenga mayores ingresos para lque la familia disfrute.
texts.en:
Josefa is 32 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two children. She lives with her children and her partner in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

The members of the communal bank “27 De Mayo” make a living from agriculture. They all live in Cadial. They have practically been raised in this area and the majority make a living from agricultural work and raising livestock. 

Josefa makes a living by planting corn and rice. She also breeds pigs and chickens. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase urea, insecticides, weedkiller, and corn for the chickens. With the help of the loan she will be able to purchase what she needs for her seedlings. The challenge she faces is the lack of irrigation for the crops.

She makes her purchases and carries out her sales in the city of Ventanas.

What she most wants is to have greater earnings for her family to enjoy in future.

loans.use: to purchase urea, insecticides, weed killers, and corn for her chickens

loans.name: Lilia Esperanza

texts.es:
Lilia tiene 60 años de edad es casada ella vive con el esposo y sus hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Lilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticida,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. Las compras  lo realizan en Ventanas. Su  sueño es comprar un terreno. El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar mucho más. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Lilia is 60 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. 

She is a member of the communal bank “Bruniquilde”, which is located in the rural community of Calabi. It belongs to the canton of Ventanas and its members make a living from agricultural work and raising livestock.

Lilia makes a living by sowing corn. She is requesting the loan for agricultural supplies she needs, such as compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, and fungicide. She will make her purchases in Ventanas. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenge she faces is that of working a lot more. In her free time she likes to rest and watch television.

loans.use: to sow corn

loans.name: Roberto Timoteo

texts.es:
ROBERTO tiene 39 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

ROBERTO  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza y una bomba para fumigar. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas.

El sueño es progresar en el trabajo tener mayor ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver la television y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Roberto is 39 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the communal bank “27 De Mayo” make a living from agriculture. They all live in  the rural community of Cadial and have practically grown up in this area. They mostly make a living from agricultural work and working with livestock.

Roberto makes a living by sowing corn and rice. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase urea, insecticides, weed killer, and a fumigation bomb. With the help of the loan he will be able to purchase everything he needs for sowing his crops.

He makes his purchase and carries out his sales in Ventanas.

His dream is to progress in his job and have greater revenue. In his free time he likes to watch television and play sport.

loans.use: to purchase urea, insecticides, weed killer, and a fumigation bomb

loans.name: Glen

texts.en: Glen, 31, simply lives with his family within his local community. He wants to improve his farming business to obtain better crop production but his capital intended in buying farm inputs is not enough.  For this reason, he is asking a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers .This amount of loan will allow him to increase his yields every cropping season. Glen believes that through his requested loan and hard work, he will further generate better income and secure his family welfare.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Melarda

texts.en:
Melarda is a married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business as well as her vegetable retail sales. This is the source of her income.
Melarda works hard to support her husband in supporting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children. She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell like onion, potato, beans, ginger, and more stocks for the store like noodles, canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her stocks thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Melarda hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of their income.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell like onion, potato, beans, ginger, and more stocks for the store like noodles, canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Redemption

texts.en:
Redemption is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a mother of five children. Redemption is engaged in the fishing business with her husband.

Redemption is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat such as plywood, nails and paint. With this, they will be able to improve the performance of their fishing boat thus allowing them to enhance their catch which they can sell to the market.

In the future, Redemption hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat such as plywood, nails and paint

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por otro préstamo para invertir en la temporada navideña, comprara gas propano, cal, chicharrón, quesillo y aceite entre otros, para seguir tabajando.
El crédito anterior le ayudo al crecimiento de las ventas de su negocio, pues surtió muy bien su inventario comprando gas por mayor, tiene más clientes, la economía familiar va mejorando a medida crece el negocio.Con los nuevos ingresos ha implementado la venta de pupusas en su recidencia.
texts.en:
Ana decided to get another loan so she can invest in the Christmas season. She will purchase propane gas, lime, pork crackling, cheese, oil, and other things so she can continue working.

The previous loan helped her to increase the number of sales for her business as she stocked her inventory very well, buying gas wholesale. She has more customers and her family’s finances are improving as her business is growing. With the new earnings she has started selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) in her home.

loans.use: to buy propane gas, lime, pork crackling, cheese, oil, and other things

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu would like to diversify her businesses. The previous loan enabled her to save money to open a fruits and vegetable business. However, she still operates her fish selling business. 

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for her business

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en: Bintihamisi appreciates for her previous kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting for a loan of ksh.10,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Daraja Group

texts.en:
Daraja is a Nuru International group of two farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Daraja collectively guarantee the loan.
Peter pictured with the hand raised up is a representative of the group. He is 57 years old, married with seven children. Only one of them is in school. He has been a member of this group since 2012.
The loan for KIVA in this coming season will enable him obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer which he believes will increase his farm yields. Peter just like other members of his group will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. He will obtain food for his household as well as sell the surplus and find capital to invest in a vegetable selling busin.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Kobohendo Nuru Group

texts.en:
This group of two farmers is called Kobohendo. It is a group of Nuru International farmers and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.
Francis who is raising up his hand has been a member of this group since the year 2012. He is 51 years old and is married with six children who go to school. Francis is keen to ensure he gets a good harvest that will sustain his family with food. He has gained a lot of knowledge on better farming methods. However, he is constrained financially in acquiring farm inputs. It is for this reason that Francis is requesting for a loan to enable him obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer.
With the loan, Francis will obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer and is hopeful that this will enable him get a bounty harvest that will provide his entire household with food. He believes he will also sell the surplus and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Huikap Water Supply Shg Group

texts.en:
Premila belongs to Huikap Water Supply SHG Group, and she is the featured profile member. She is pictured with a raised hand. Her main source of generating income is weaving. She and her friends form the group, and they are supporting one another financially and morally. All of them reside in the same neighbourhood, which is about 40 km far from the main town of Imphal City.

Premila used to use her small savings to pay for security deposits, as the yarn retailer would ask for security deposits. In order to get abundant supplies of woven products, Premila hires weavers sometimes and supplies them with the requisite materials like yarn and cloth materials. Premila pays them their weaving charge once they are ready. She collects the woven products and takes them to the marketplace to sell. Her woven collections consist of bed covers, pillow covers, mosquito nets, blanket covers, wrap-around skirts and women's shawls.

With this Kiva loan, Premila is planning to hire more weavers and purchase more yarn and thread for weaving purposes. She is also interested in getting a new loom for the hired weavers to use. She will grant them their wages and supply them with the required materials, as she will be able to meet the demands the retailer has asked for. She will continue her business and aspires to become one of the largest producers of woven clothes and tailored clothes in the area.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in embroidery works and weaving. They are looking toward Kiva for support and believe that it will enhance their merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase different types of yarn, thread and silk for weaving to make more money to support the kids' education.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Emilia tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en casa de su mamá. Se dedica al comercio desde hace alrededor 10 años, ella inició su negocio de antojitos mexicanos por qué le gusta mucho el comercio y es conocida en su colonia; también le ayuda a vender a una señora productos cosméticos por catálogo y recibe un porcentaje de comisión.

Emilia ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de antojitos mexicanos como quesadillas, pambazos, gorditas, tacos de bistec, chuleta, longaniza, pozole, enchiladas potosinas y tostadas; teniendo su puesto abierto de lunes a domingo. Pide este préstamo para comprar un comal más grande, ya que el que tiene actualmente no le es suficiente para la cantidad de clientes que tiene. 

Gracias a estos 10 años de esfuerzo en su trabajo ha logrado estar renovando sus electrodomésticos y gozar de estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Emilia is a micro-entrepreneur and client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story. Emilia is 40 years old, has four children, and cohabitates with her partner in her mother's house. She has worked in sales for about 10 years and started her Mexican snack business because she enjoys working in sales and is known throughout her suburb. She also helps a lady sell mail-order cosmetics and receives a percentage of the commission. Emilia sells all kinds of Mexican snacks to her customers, like quesadillas, sausage and potato sandwiches, stuffed fried tortillas, beef tacos, pork chops, pork sausage, stew, Potosi style enchiladas, and tostadas. Her stall is open Monday through Sunday. She is requesting this loan to purchase a bigger hotplate, since her current one isn't big enough for the amount of the customers she serves. Thanks to her 10 years of hard work she has been able to replace her appliances and enjoy financial stability with her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new hotplate and be able to serve more customers

loans.name: Nhep

texts.en:
Nhep is 33 years old and married. Nhep and his wife live separately due to unavoidable family circumstances. He currently lives with his mother in the remote area of Baray, Kampong Thom province. Nhep is engaged in farming rice and providing motor taxi services to earn a living. He is now the only breadwinner of the family.

He is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva lenders, so that he can buy a new motorcycle taxi. The one he has is almost 10 years old and in need of costly repairs. This will enable him to continue working and generating income for his family. Nhep relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their help in lending the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: ana de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de los productos y los buenos precios, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y asi poder continuar con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their children. For 3 years, she has worked selling clothes. She has her business set up in the market that is near her home. She has many customers, due to the variety of her products and good prices.

Ana is requesting a loan for the purchase of wholesale clothing. In this way she will be able to continue her business, which generates excellent income for her, and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Luis Alexis

texts.es: luis de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Luis is 31 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. For 2 years, he has worked selling clothing as a street vendor in the different communities and markets that are found near his home. With this, he gets income and can pay for some household expenses. Luis is requesting a loan for the purchase of more wholesale clothing, as this is his only source of work, and in this way, he can give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula de 62 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 4 años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de us hogar, vive en casa propia con su nieta y su bisnieta Doña Paula solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Paula is 62 years old. For 4 years, she has worked selling tortillas out of her house. She works from Monday to Sunday. She has a lot of customers, because she is a very hardworking and friendly person. With the earnings that she obtains, she is able to pay for her household expenses. She lives in her own house with her granddaughter and her great-granddaughter.

Paula is requesting a loan to purchase corn by the quintal (about 100 pounds) in order to continue preparing her tortillas, and in this way, obtain better earnings to have better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the quintal (about 100 pounds).

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman who is a very hard working and enterprising woman. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Revelina

texts.en: Revelina is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three grown up children. Farming is their main source of income. Revelina is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With this loan she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita is a mother who has four children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school. As a way of generating income, she engages in making icing candies that she sells to store owners and at a school campus. She aims to make more icing candies to sell, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy powdered sugar, eggs, plastic and straws that she needs to make icing candies to sell. She believes that this loan will help her improve the business that she manages.

loans.use: to buy powdered sugar, eggs, plastic and straws needed in making icing candies to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mary Joan

texts.en: Mary Joan runs a small variety store in her community. She is 23 years old and was gifted with two siblings. She and her husband aim to provide her family a comfortable lifestyle. In order to make her goal realistic, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock of snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, noodles, seasonings, laundry soaps and soft drinks to sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will improve more of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, noodles, seasonings, laundry soaps and soft drinks to restock her retail store

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nam is a 45-year-old farmer who is working on 1 hectare of land. As other inhabitants, she primarily grows rice to sell in the local markets. With the help from her husband, she has been involved in this occupation for almost 28 years and is able to make an income of USD $5 per day.

Nam needs much economic assistance in order to improve her income. This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy a piece of land to improve her farming productivity. She hopes to get a good harvest in years to come and meet the needs of her family with the profits.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to improve her farming productivity.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy meat for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale.
